topic,body
trade,"mounting trade friction u.s. japan raised fears among many asia's exporting nations row could inflict far-reaching economic damage, businessmen officials said. told reuter correspondents asian capitals u.s. move japan might boost protectionist sentiment u.s. lead curbs american imports products. exporters said conflict would hurt long-run, short-term tokyo's loss might gain. u.s. said impose 300 mln dlrs tariffs imports japanese electronics goods april 17, retaliation japan's alleged failure stick pact sell semiconductors world markets cost. unofficial japanese estimates put impact tariffs 10 billion dlrs spokesmen major electronics firms said would virtually halt exports products hit new taxes. ""we able business,"" said spokesman leading japanese electronics firm matsushita electric industrial co ltd <mc.t>. ""if tariffs remain place length time beyond months mean complete erosion exports (of goods subject tariffs) u.s.,"" said tom murtha, stock analyst tokyo office broker <james capel co>. taiwan, businessmen officials also worried. ""we aware seriousness u.s. threat japan serves warning us,"" said senior taiwanese trade official asked named. taiwan trade trade surplus 15.6 billion dlrs last year, 95 pct u.s. surplus helped swell taiwan's foreign exchange reserves 53 billion dlrs, among world's largest. ""we must quickly open markets, remove trade barriers cut import tariffs allow imports u.s. products, want defuse problems possible u.s. retaliation,"" said paul sheen, chairman textile exporters <taiwan safe group>. senior official south korea's trade promotion association said trade dispute u.s. japan might also lead pressure south korea, whose chief exports similar japan. last year south korea trade surplus 7.1 billion dlrs u.s., 4.9 billion dlrs 1985. malaysia, trade officers businessmen said tough curbs japan might allow hard-hit producers semiconductors third countries expand sales u.s. hong kong, newspapers alleged japan selling below-cost semiconductors, electronics manufacturers share view. businessmen said short-term commercial advantage would outweighed u.s. pressure block imports. ""that short-term view,"" said lawrence mills, director-general federation hong kong industry. ""if whole purpose prevent imports, one day extended sources. much serious hong kong disadvantage action restraining trade,"" said. u.s. last year hong kong's biggest export market, accounting 30 pct domestically produced exports. australian government awaiting outcome trade talks u.s. japan interest concern, industry minister john button said canberra last friday. ""this kind deterioration trade relations two countries major trading partners serious matter,"" button said. said australia's concerns centred coal beef, australia's two largest exports japan also significant u.s. exports country. meanwhile u.s.-japanese diplomatic manoeuvres solve trade stand-off continue. japan's ruling liberal democratic party yesterday outlined package economic measures boost japanese economy. measures proposed include large supplementary budget record public works spending first half financial year. also call stepped-up spending emergency measure stimulate economy despite prime minister yasuhiro nakasone's avowed fiscal reform program. deputy u.s. trade representative michael smith makoto kuroda, japan's deputy minister international trade industry (miti), due meet washington week effort end dispute."

ship,"tug crews new south wales (nsw), victoria western australia yesterday lifted ban foreign-flag ships carrying containers nsw ports still disrupted separate dispute, shipping sources said. ban, imposed week ago pay claim, prevented movement port nearly 20 vessels, said. pay dispute went hearing arbitration commission today. meanwhile, disruption began today cargo handling ports sydney, newcastle port kembla, said. industrial action nsw ports part week action called nsw trades labour council protest changes state's workers' compensation laws. shipping sources said various port unions appear taking turn work short time start shift walk off. cargo handling ports disrupted, container movements affected, stopped altogether, said. said could say long disruption go effect shipping movements."

acq,"sumitomo bank ltd <sumi.t> certain lose status japan's profitable bank result merger heiwa sogo bank, financial analysts said. osaka-based sumitomo, desposits around 23.9 trillion yen, merged heiwa sogo, small, struggling bank estimated 1.29 billion dlrs unrecoverable loans, october. despite link-up, sumitomo president koh komatsu told reuters confident bank quickly regain position. ""we'll back position first place within three years,"" komatsu said interview. said merger initially reduce sumitomo's profitability efficiency, vastly expand sumitomo's branch network tokyo metropolitan area relatively weak. financial analysts divided whether quickly gamble pay off. said sumitomo may paid much heiwa sogo view smaller bank's large debts. others argue merger cost effective creating comparable branch network scratch. analysts agreed bank aggressive. expanded overseas, entered lucrative securities business geared domestic competition, questioned wisdom moves. ""they've made bold moves put everything place. largely hands,"" said kleinwort benson ltd financial analyst simon smithson. among sumitomo's problems limits placed move enter u.s. securities business taking share american investment bank goldman, sachs co. sumitomo last august agreed pay 500 mln dlrs 12.5 pct limited partnership bank, time least, federal reserve board forbidden exchange personnel, increase business other. ""the tie-up widely looked lame duck fed stricter sumitomo expected,"" said one analyst. komatsu said move pay time. ""u.s. regulations change near future so, various things. wait two three years, 21st century,"" komatsu said. komatsu also willing patient possible routes securities business home. article 65 securities exchange act, japan's version u.s. glass-steagall act, separates commercial investment banking. walls two crumbling komatsu said hopes deregulation create new opportunities. ""we need find new business chances,"" komatsu said. ""in cases securities related, cases trust bank related. that's kind deregulation want."" changes occur, sumitomo focus domestic securities business profitable government bond dealing strengthening relations meiko securities co ltd, holds five pct share, komatsu said. said sumitomo cautiously optimistic entering securities business swiss universal bank subsidiary, banca del gottardo. finance ministry expected grant licences securities subsidiaries u.s. commercial banks soon, following similar decision subsidiaries european universal banks parent holds less 50 pct. komatsu reluctant push hard similar decision gottardo subsidiary. ""we want make waves. expect allowed two three years,"" said. like city banks, sumitomo also pushing expand lending individuals small medium businesses replace disappearing demand big business, added. analysts said sumitomo devote lot time digesting recent initiatives, including merger ailing heiwa sogo. ""it's (sumitomo) bold strategies,"" said kleinwort's smithson. ""after that, question absorbing juggling around. next decade see strategy right wrong."""

trade,"top u.s. official said japan little chance convincing u.s. drop threatened trade sanctions, despite efforts japanese team left washington today. michael armacost, secretary state political affairs, asked press conference whether japan's moves boost domestic economy open markets could persuade u.s. impose tariffs japanese imports said, replied: ""...it probably early figures demonstrate situation turned around permit result described."" armacost said u.s. hopes japan take steps lift domestic economy reduce dependence exports, remove barriers imports settle outstanding trade issues. ""there obvious problems moment trade area, wish problems divert attention important areas cooperation continue exist security political issues,"" said. ""the question whether cooperative actions governments reduce (trade) imbalance whether congress takes action reduce protectionist legislation,"" said."

""coming does, san miguel corp ucpb reached agreement price shares method payment, suit direct contravention government's expressed desire reach amicable settlement controversy april 15,"" statement added. san miguel spokesman said comment cojuangco's court petition, adding: ""any statement coming us might interpreted adversarial."" meanwhile, ramon diaz, head government panel sequestered shares last year, said soriano eligible buy major portion shares united states citizen. sequestered shares split 24 mln ""a"" shares, owned filipinos, 14 mln ""b"" shares available foreign buyers. smc sources said soriano personally among prospective buyers. said shares would purchased <a.soriano> group companies, smc, neptunia unnamed institutional investors. soriano named one buyers bid march 1986 33 mln shares controlled ucpb. sale aborted diaz's presidential commission good government sequestered shares suspicion owned cojuangco, close associate former president ferdinand marcos. cojuangco lives self-imposed exile u.s.. shares grew 38.1 mln 15 pct stock dividend announced last june. ""but everything hold now."" smc spokesman said know controversy would resolved company's annual stockholders' meeting, scheduled may 14. san miguel corp reported sales revenue 12.2 billion pesos 1986, 11 pct 10.9 billion peso sales 1985. said unaudited net profit neighbourhood 700 mln pesos, increase 50 pct 1985."

nickel,"nickel prices unlikely rise significantly current levels unless steps taken reduce production, shearson lehman brothers said quarterly nickel market report. market recovered slightly around 1.72 dlrs lb yesterday four year low 1.55 dlrs early january, due absence soviet nickel cathode deliveries, shearson sees soviet shipments soon returning last year's buoyant levels, ease current tightness. output reductions producers take effect later year likely offset increases elsewhere. shearson said nickel market virtually balance 1987, total non-socialist world demand 556,000 tonnes, compared estimated 544,000 tonnes 1986, production 505,000 tonnes (504,000) imports socialist countries 47,000 tonnes (50,000). forecast prices edge higher year first quarter average 1.67 dlrs lb 1.77 dlrs last quarter. year's average around 1.72 dlrs lb compared 1.76 dlrs 1986, using london metal exchange cash metal prices dollar terms assuming average 1987 sterling exchange rate 1.55 dlrs."

acq,"senate banking committee chairman william proxmire (d-wis) said planned introduce legislation shortly require greater public disclosure corporate takeovers fairer treatment shareholders. speaking national association manufacturers, proxmire said recent insider trading stock scandals increased chance congress act curb abuses. ""we proposing legislation would provide disclosure, would fairer shareholders, would insure takeovers properly financed,"" said. among provisions, bill would reduce threshold notifying securities exchange commission investor group acquired percentage stock company three pct current five pct threshold within 10 days, proxmire said. addition, would pre-notificaton requirement investor intended aquire three pct would filed sec. proxmire said pre-notification requirement meant prevent arbitragers jump general public knowing coming takeover attempts. proxmire said would call extending period tender offer must kept open williams act 60 business days current 20 business days. bill would provide private suits acquiring company violated time period tender offer. correct abuses financing takeovers, proxmire said legislation would aim insuring current margin requirments properly enforced. federal reserve board 50 pct margin requirement purchasing stock, proxmire said generally enforced hostile takeovers. rather, groups individuals leading takeover declare raise capital takeover without actually putting money, proxmire said. said bill would allow private suits damages failure meet federal reserve's 50 pct margin requirements. bill also would require disclose several investors form alliance hostile takeover. ""when pickens icahn get together want people know it,"" proxmire said. proxmire said favored approach used britain towards two-tiered tender offers insures shareholders recieve equal treatment. said expected amendments bill also would cover defensive mechanisms green mail poison pills. proxmire said intended introduce bill later month predicted senate committee would act spring. said hopeful congress could pass bill year."

""there fundamental weakness paris accord,"" said. ""we looking ways strengthening it, want discuss here. stoltenberg said louvre agreement working despite ""slight firming"" yen dollar. poehl noted dollar/mark parity unchanged since february 22 without bundesbank sell marks support dollar. ""the louvre agreement honored market,"" said. poehl said west germany lived side bargain paris preparing way tax cuts accelerated way stimulating growth. poehl said, however, japan yet fulfilled pledges economic stimulation. ""and see united states able promised paris reducing budget deficit -- get congress,"" added. stoltenberg reiterated west german concern fall dollar, noting mark 85 pct dollar nearly 20 pct trade-weighted basis. money-supply,"robert heller, member federal reserve board, said expects ""more modest levels"" growth money supply year. ""in view, would logical, also desireable development,"" said speech prepared delivery economic forum chapman college orange, calif. text released washington. said effect lower inflation financial deregulation monetary aggregates largely finished. ""consequently, monetary growth may return modest levels,"" heller said. noted growth money supply slowed mid-january. ""i would surprised monetary aggregates grow rather slowly balance year well,"" added. heller said danger renewed price inflation. ""the pricing behavior american producers response price increases foreign competitors crucial economic future,"" said. widespread domestic price rises response rising import prices would ""generalize inflationary forces emanating foreign trade sector"" might gain market share u.s. producers. ""a return stagflation late 1970s may well result behavior pattern,"" heller warned. said ""we federal reserve disciplined conduct monetary policy."" heller said said government also exercise fiscal discipline cut deficit spending restraint rather new taxes. ""the imposition new taxes would tend rekindle inflation certainly would make us competitive international markets,"" heller said. said u.s. economy expand nearly three pct 1987, aided higher exports europe canada. free trade agreement currently negotiated canada ""would exceedingly helpful allowing american producers compete effectively country,"" heller said."

trade,"financial analysts say pleased congressional moves trim next year's federal budget deficit believe actions little help improve u.s. trade deficit buoy economy. house representatives expected vote tomorrow approve trillion-dollar budget blueprint coming fiscal year reduces deficit 38 billion dlrs. similarly, senate budget committee approved plan would cut federal red ink 37 billion dlrs next year. ""in terms economy, 37-38 billion dlrs infinitesimal, cuts magnitude little impact economy trade deficit,"" said stanley collander, touche ross federal budget policy analyst. ""at best, small positive effect,"" collander said interview. federal reserve board chairman paul volcker repeatedly told congress cutting federal red ink would go long way help reduce massive trade deficit also help ease downward pressure value dollar. u.s. government attempted remedy trade imbalance driving value dollar. volcker warned fall dollar's value fraught danger. decline, said, could refuel inflation imported goods become expensive chase away foreign capital needed finance federal budget deficit. addition, february, u.s. officials meeting major industrialized nations paris agreed value dollar dropped enough world exchange rates stabilized around current levels. part agreement, japan west germany agreed take steps stimulate economies united states agreed cut budget deficit. alternative driving dollar way deal trade deficit, volcker said recently, reduce u.s. consumption, particularly federal spending. ""if deal budget deficit, everything else going counterproductive,"" volcker said recent testimony senate banking committee. volcker also said would prefer tighten government's purse strings fed tighten credit supply action needed fight inflationary pressures assure continued flow foreign capital united states. analysts say fed tightening could choke current modest economic expansion threaten recession. kemper financial services economist john silvia stressed deficit reduction better none. said size cuts consideration enough give federal reserve board flexibility needs steer economy keep value dollar plunging world exchange markets. ""there's doubt deficit reduction helps, objective stabilize dollar perserve fed's flexibility conduct monetary policy, answer is, enough,"" silvia told reuters. u.s. trade deficit become one government's vexing persistent problems. 1986 deficit 169.8 billion dlrs yet little indication year's figure lower, though administration officials predicted drop 20 30 billion dlrs year's end. past, volcker joked never lost sleep worrying whether congress would cut much fat federal budget. hand, also made clear attached gradually declining deficit ceilings set 1986-1991 period last year's gramm-rudman balanced budget law. new law set ceiling 108 billion dlrs next year's federal deficit, house senate budget committees conceded budget plans would fall short deficit reduction goal 25 billion dlrs. ""for political reasons, 35 40 billion dlrs going get"" congress present time, said touche ross's collander. ""to something would extraordinary, remarkable very, difficult."" collander said real danger congress end short deficit reduction goal set budget panels. ""to extent, become minimum acceptable reduction level,"" explained. ""anything less look like failure wall street."" budget plan debate house floor would lower estimated 171 billion dlr deficit year beginning october one 133 billion dlrs cutting defense domestic programs 38 billion dlrs anticipated spending levels next year. senate budget committee called deficit nearly 134 billion dlrs 18.5 billion dlrs new taxes amount spending cuts."

""in words, monetary policy measures required different -- sometimes diametrically opposed -- needed money stock increasing result mounting economic activity."" though koehler known liberal generally monetarist bundesbank board, comments marked first time cuts rates concretely suggested counterpoint overly strong monetary growth, dealers said. r"

money-fx,"finance ministers seven major industrialized nations agreed need stabilize currencies current levels said action needed reduce trade imbalances sustain economic growth. communique issued four-hour meeting u.s. treasury ended last night, ministers said value dollar currencies basically correct now, welcomed new measures planned japanese boost economy. west german finance minister gerhard stoltenberg called ""good meeting"" brief remarks exchanged reporters ministers seemed pleased outcome. shortly communique issued foreign exchange trading opened tokyo, bank japan intervened prevent yen rising quickly. communique said, ""the ministers governors reaffirmed commitment cooperative approach agreed recent paris meeting. agreed, however, actions essential resist rising protectionist pressures, sustain global economic expansion reduce trade imbalances."" welcomed plans set week japan's ruling liberal democratic party stimulate economy communique termed ""extraordinary urgent measures"" including ""unprecedented front-end loading public works expenditures."" meeting so-called group seven brought together ministers central bank governors seven major industrial democracies, united states, japan, west germany, france, britain, italy canada. communique said ministers reaffirmed commitment cooperation reached meeting february 22 paris agreed stabilize foreign exchange rates then-current levels. weeks followed, dollar continued fall japanese yen despite massive dollar purchases bank japan central banks trading around postwar lows. japan come growing criticism united states european countries modest efforts open markets outside competition reduce exports. communique said japan affirmed intention open domestic markets foreign goods services elaborate. said officials ""reaffirmed view around current levels currencies within ranges broadly consistent economic fundamentals basic policy intentions outlined louvre meeting."""
earn,"dutch insurer aegon nv <aegn.as> reported 6.4 pct increase 1986 net profits 327.1 mln guilders said expected moderate increase profits 1987. total revenue eight pct lower 1986 7.97 billion guilders vs 8.7 billion guilders 1985. company said revenues due lower foreign exchange rates change accounting practice. added revenues would risen seven pct changes occurred. revenue dutch operations rose five pct 1986, mainly due life insurance business. health insurance revenues netherlands also rose despite notable shift insurances lower premiums higher personal risks. damage insurances made losses, mainly due car damage insurances. aegon specify loss. united states, revenue guilders health life insurance lower. aegon said due change accounting u.s. annuities. aegon said annuities subject strong personal investment influences accounted differently traditional insurances. change accounting practice another change account profits made fixed interest investments, resulted incidental rise net profits 31 mln guilders. aegon said incidental negative influences net profits slightly higher, lower dollar rate, high initial costs new products, cost new headquarters hague. 1986, large number new insurance products emerged netherlands u.s., aegon said. large initial costs products depressed net profits somewhat. monumental corp, u.s. insurer merged aegon may 1986, saw profits almost completely eroded costs made small contribution group's profits. aegon said written-off 657 mln guilders goodwill monumental corp. aegon's net equity 2.71 billion guilders december 1986, 3.46 billion year before."

,"india's private businessmen say placed unequal footing raising money capital market government companies wooing investors issuing attractive tax-free bonds. stock brokers bankers polled reuters said although equity shares debenture issues floated private firms provide higher return shorter maturity, fast losing popular appeal liable wealth income taxes. brokers said many investors transferring funds government company bonds tax-free status easy transferability. 100 private companies postponed plans issue equity shares debentures first quarter fiscal 1987/88 partly account fierce competition public sector bonds, merchant banker said. included equity shares rights issue worth one billion rupees planned issued month tata fertilisers ltd, said, adding issue postponed indefinitely. ""the government bonds making serious inroads private sector companies' resources,"" said r. p. goenka, president federation indian chambers commerce industry. ""the discriminatory tax treatment done away equal facilities provided two sectors mobilise resources market common both,"" goenka said. senior finance ministry official said government private firms free compete raise resources, adding correct public sector-issued bonds preventing private firms raising money stock market. ""debentures equity shares floated private companies still account least 60 pct total capital raised stock exchanges,"" ministry official said. spokesman bombay stock brokers batliwala karani said government bonds valued 20 billion rupees 40 pct 50 billion rupees raised government non-government firms domestic capital market 1986/87. share 35 40 pct 36.95 billion rupees mobilised 1985/86, said. ""individuals well also investing bonds gain tax benefits small investors going equities debentures floated private companies selective basis,"" spokesman said. maturity period government company india's four major stock exchanges. sold freely stock market simple endorsement debentures sold company one year, brokers said. government companies trying capitalise boom stock market since 1984/85 sparked liberal tax concessions reforms exchange operations, brokers said. national thermal power corp, ntpc, first government company issue bonds raise one billion rupees january last year, breaking mobilised 3.83 billion rupees last year authorised 1.5 billion last month indian railway finance corporation's record susbcription totalled 5.5 billion rupees authorised 2.5 billion. cases, government saying time ability keep debt crisis turning economic rout rests sustained economic growth. since debtor countries must look wealthier states markets products well financial assistance, economic weakness developed nations' economies poses fundamental worries. debtor countries, including poorest states, avenues open earning foreign exchange, including key one exports. u.s. economy, fifth year expansion, served mainstay developing country exports, seen rather feeble year, growing 2.3 pct, according imf. reason high trade deficit, united states pressuring japan west germany ignite economies interest,"nigel lawson, britain's chancellor exchequer, said countries may need cut interest rates aim maintaining exchange rate stability. speaking journalists one day group seven countries reaffirmed goals set paris six weeks ago, said central banks would continue intervene ""as necessary."" said g-7 countries concerned japan stimulate domestic demand welcomed measures outlined japanese finance minister kiichi miyazawa yesterday. lawson said still worried risk simultaneous recession united states, japan west germany, though less gave march 17 budget speech british parliament. ""if anything i'm little bit less concerned, still risk,"" said. asked united states consider increasing interest rates support dollar, said, ""if need changes relative interest rates, need rise interest rates united states."" lawson said concern expressed yesterday's meetings slow progress united states made reducing budget deficit. ""we believe worthwhile progress reducing deficit year. important thing continue year year,"" lawson said. february 22 louvre accord called efforts stabilize currencies then-current exchange rates. six weeks followed japanese yen continued rise dollar despite massive central bank intervention. asked whether intervention sign weakness louvre accord, said, ""i think so. intervention would called sign weakness."" although intervention could cause inflation, lawson said, ""the world appear inflationary mode ... one vigilant."" said yesterday's g-7 statement, affirmed ""current levels"" exchange rates appropriate, ""carefully worded."" ""we know mean, mean thing,"" said. lawson said financial markets seem believe japanese measures outlined louvre accord source weakness agreement. therefore, g-7 countries welcomed miyazawa's presentation plans supplemental budget stimulate domestic demand. particularly welcomed goal immediate increase public works spending, lawson said package also involved second stage increase expenditures second half year."

potato,"trading london potato futures market suspended, richard harris, chairman london potato futures association (lpfa), said statement floor members. response strong representations potato marketing board (pmb) complaining gross distortion price say result large deliveries physical market april futures position expires. pmb sought immediate suspension futures trading asked lpfa take action restore relationship futures physicals. farmers merchants alleged squeeze cornering market harris pointed recent investigations association futures brokers dealers (afbd), international commodities clearing house (icch) parties, found evidence substantiate this. main complaint sections physical market say unrealistic futures premium pmb's average ex-farm price. april futures traded morning 168 170 stg per tonne compared pmb's average price 104 stg. bill englebright, joint secretary lpfa said two-tier market physical potatoes. said quality potatoes short supply prepackers paying 145 165 stg per tonne best samples. lesser quality grades traded 100 stg. merchants fear large tonnage delivered april futures contract end month, possibly disrupt physical market. harris said lpfa rule book allows management committee take steps necessary correct malpractice assured committee monitoring situation."

iron-steel,"steel stocks, healthy runup recently, still present short term investment opportunities, according steel analysts. others say upturn, based strong orders firm prices spring, strictly seasonal end soon. recommend taking profits. ""it's time year. strictly seasonal,"" said charles bradford merrill lynch co. ""orders strong two months, signs (order rates) starting dive already."" dean witter reynolds inc analyst clarence morrison sees short-term potential group, includes usx corp <x>, bethlehem steel corp <bs>, armco inc <as> inland steel industries inc <iad>. ""there still attractiveness steels short- intermediate-term based improved order rates rising prices,"" morrison said. recommends one stock, however, inland, modernizing steelmaking operations make efficient. despite bearishness, merrill's bradford continues recommend armco, sees major turnaround. armco's steelmaking operations profitable, balance sheet improved, oilfield equipment business slimmed put joint venture usx, bradford noted. ""it's high-quality investment situation yet they've come long way,"" said. ""we think stock moderately better market,"" said. armco shares, trading 1/4 10 today, could go 12, possibly high 15, said. bradford sees armco earning 50 75 cts share 1987, special gains recouped investment tax credits, losses last year. armco's 1988 earnings could significantly higher, said. bradford recommending sale usx shares. ""we buy 20 gets 28, let somebody else it,"" said. steel energy concern earn one dlr share 1987, half coming asset sales, two dlrs 2.50 dlrs 1988, bradford said. ""but lot depends oil prices,"" added. 60 pct usx's sales come oil natural gas. analysts, including michelle galanter applebaum salomon brothers inc, recommend usx. ""the company's done lot (of restructuring), market's given credit for,"" said. sees stock going mid 30s higher. usx trading 1/8 28-1/2. predicts usx earn 18 cts share year 2.73 dlrs next year large losses 1986. applebaum, also positive armco inland, recommending stocks since last november. peter marcus painewebber inc neutral group although said earnings outlook improved third quarter. sees potential trouble beyond then. ""i think (steel) prices bookings basis start drop summer,"" said. applebaum salomon brothers also sees seasonal dropoff later year. ""but positives negatives,"" said, citing reduced capacity domestic industry, better prices, weaker dollar, cause steel imports drop slightly last year."

""while cannot yet sure outcome, ensure bill protectionist,"" said. baker also urged international monetary fund's executive board review possible modifications fund's compensatory financing facility annual meeting fall. ""we pay particular attention lack continuing conditionality associated use cff whether shortfalls export earnings indeed temporary,"" said."

,"swiss franc notes issued may 1 must provided prospectus, virtually erasing difference information requirements notes public bonds, according convention drafted bankers' federation. convention requires lead managers draw prospectus naming syndicate members providing certain details borrower. contrast public issues, though, prospectus must merely made available clients request via syndicate banks rather published distributed printed form. convention, approved banks earlier month, replaces earlier convention dating 1984 deals widely seen increasingly anachronistic distinction notes public issues. publication follows long debate among bankers amount information provided borrowers, heightened difficulties swiss franc issues recent occasions . applies notes units least 50,000 swiss francs, usual denomination, placed directly customers syndicate quoted bourse. anything smaller 50,000 francs governed unchanged, demanding rules apply public issues. bankers contacted reuters said envisage new requirement would present problems push fees. many banks said time providing legal minimum information. traditionally, notes private placements, also known, medium term instruments denominated 50,000 francs placed largely institutional investors. normally brought onto open market never quoted stock exchange. years distinction notes publicly quoted traded bonds gradually broke down. national bank therefore last may abolished remaining restrictions maturities denominations still formally divided them. however, competence national bank rule prospectuses banks since continued largely before: public issues, generally quoted stock exchanges, provided detailed prospectuses, notes, virtually always not-quoted, equipped ""information memorandums"" varying degrees detail. new convention attempts put end this. says notes prospectus must contain following seven points: - precise terms issue - details company performance six months since last annual report - naming guarantors - source information - details ratings, insofar made - equity linked notes, details company's shares listed price high lows least last three years. - lead manager required borrower provide information lifetime notes progress business. according figures swiss bank corp, total note issues foreign borrowers reached 18.6 billion swiss francs last year, compared 23.6 billion francs borrowed form public bonds. majority note issues japanese borrowers."

reserves,"spain's foreign reserves rose 905 mln dlrs february total 17.05 billion dlrs, compared 14.11 billion dlrs february 1986, bank spain figures show. new accounting system introduced month, spain's foreign reserves exclude foreign currency held financial institutions. previous system, spain's foreign reserves would risen 391 mln dlrs february, taking account fall 514 mln dlrs financial institutions' foreign currency position. january year, central bank's foreign reserves rose 143 mln dlrs, financial institutions' foreign currency position fell 118 mln dlrs."

trade,"canada's trade picture brightened considerably, underscoring economists' predictions sector would post long awaited recovery year. federal government reported today monthly surplus soared 1.25 billion canadian dlrs february, double january's 623 mln dlrs surplus sharply higher february 1986's 189 mln dlr tally. ""hopefully beginning trend,"" said richardson greenshields canada ltd economist susan clark toronto. economists generally expect large gains next months, looking upward trend throughout year. ""we thought trade balance would improve ... year, certainly looks morning's figure indicative that,"" commented economist james donegan toronto securities firm midland doherty ltd. statistics canada reported surplus driven 23 pct gain automobile product exports record 3.2 billion dls month. ""recovery automotive sector helped push value exports 5.9 pct february,"" agency said monthly report. total exports expanded 10.44 billion dlrs 9.85 billion dlrs february, imports slipped 9.19 billion dlrs 9.23 billion dlrs. economists predicted 1987 trade surplus would end three five billion dlrs higher last year's dismal 10.1 billion dlr total. 1985 surplus 17.48 billion dlrs. money market analysts said positive trade news touched modest rally canadian dollar, rose 76.85 u.s. cts north american markets early morning closing 76.58 cts wednesday. currency hovering around 76.78 cts early afternoon trading. economists banking improved trade performance year stimulate otherwise sluggish canadian economy. money market analysts said positive trade news touched modest rally canadian dollar, rose 76.85 u.s. cts north american markets early morning closing 76.58 cts wednesday. currency hovering around 76.78 cts early afternoon trading. economists banking improved trade performance year stimulate otherwise sluggish canadian economy. say country's consumers, spending torrid pace recent years, sharply curtail outlays year help curtail flow imports country. meanwhile, demand canadian exports united states, far country's largest market, expected strong result projected rise american consumer spending relatively low value canadian currency. ""we maintain what's going drive canada's export performance income growth u.s.,"" said midland's donegan. bank nova scotia, deputy chief economist warren jestin less optimistic u.s. outlook said could mistake read much february's trade upturn. jestin said, ""given fact u.s. economy showing signs weakening--particularly car sales--it would indicate part strength (in canada's trade figures) probably transitory."""

crude,"united states' dependency foreign oil sources may reach record levels mid-1990s, according john h. lichtblau, president petroleum industry research associates. lichtblau, speaking alternative energy conference here, said u.s. may depend foreign suppliers much 52 pct oil 1995, surpasssing previous high level 47 pct 1977. ""the long term growth dependency foreign oil inevitable,"" lichtblau said. much 30 pct u.s. oil imports 1995 could come opec nations, said. lichtblau said u.s. depended foreign suppliers 33 pct oil 1986 predicted would increase 40 pct 1990. ""however, rate growth affected positively negatively government action inaction,"" lichtblau said. said one government's negative actions maintenance windfall profits tax acts disincentive developing existing fields reduces cash flow oil exploration. lichtblau called adoption international floor price crude oil help stabilize world oil prices. ""an international floor price adopted industrial countries would clearly much effective measure would much less distortive u.s. imposed alone,"" lichtblau said. development alternate energy sources synthetic fuels well increased development alaska could lessen u.s. dependency foreign oil, lichtblau said. potential alternative supplies could limit willingness opec nations raise oil prices, said. lichtblau also called federal government offer tax abatements oil drilling, fill strategic petroleum reserve faster rate develop pilot plans alternative energy."

money-fx,"treasury secretary james baker said floating exchange rate system effective hoped promoting stability preventing imbalances emerging global economy. remarks afternoon session international monetary fund's interim committee, baker said suggesting system abandoned. ""but suggest,"" said, ""that need something give stability keep headed right direction wind shifts."" said indicators serve ""as kind compass"" added structural indicators help focus attention policies. baker, however, said imf ""needs move beyond macroeconomic indicators find structural indicators help focus attention policies specific relevance imbalances face today."" treasury secretary said indicators given prominent role annual economic reviews -- article iv consultations -- fund performs. baker also told policy making group time imf adopt earlier recommendations making imf surveillance relevant national policymakers public. ""in particular, urge increased publicity imf appraisals developed article iv consultations, use follow-up reports country actions implement imf recommendations, greater use special consultation procedures,"" said. baker emphasized indicators device ""for moving beyond rhetoric action."" said provide ""more structure system, induce discipline peer pressure process policy coordination."" said fund's procedures surveillance need reviewed updated reflect use indicators. ""this matter priority executive board,"" said. baker also urged fund develop alternative medium-term economic scenarios countries ""can help us focus even clearly important imbalances, identifying options addressing analyzing implications options."" said also work done finding paths lead toward possible medium-term objectives. ""if take effective remedial action significant deviations intended course, must definitive ways indentifying right course key variables,"" said."

sugar,"sugar mill nation's second largest employer closed doors yesterday, saying run business sugar smuggled miami neighbouring dominican republic. closure haitian american sugar company (hasco) idle 3,500 employees affect many 30,000 40,000 small sugar cane planters regions around capital, company said. ""because unprecedented ever-growing smuggling, hasco regrets ... cannot continue accept delivery sugar cane april 10,"" mill warned planters earlier week. since president jean-claude duvalier fled haiti fourteen months ago, widescale smuggling basic goods cooking oil, flour, rice, sugar canned milk lowered consumer prices bankrupted several local manufacturers, throwing hundreds thousands haitians work. hasco compound, grim-faced workers lined receive last pay, spokesman georges d. rigaud showed warehouse stocked estimated 445,000 unsold 100-pound (45-kg) bags sugar. ""we closing huge stock unsold sugar. money left continue operations,"" rigaud said. said company owed 7.6 mln dlrs borrowed additional 1.5 mln dlrs order pay workers. rigaud blamed mill's problems order duvalier two years ago forbidding hasco refining sugar. said government began importing refined sugar world market prices reselling huge profit provisional military-civilian government replaced duvalier last year continued policy. ""but smuggling even state can't compete smuggled dominican refined sugar,"" rigaud said. hasco workers earned 4.20 dlrs daily, considerably usual minimum wage three dlrs. generally estimated every employed haitian supports least six people. rigaud said hasco's closing minimum would affect 280,000 300,000 people. laid-off workers bitter closure. ""we're dead, government that's causing us die,"" declared lucien felix, 34, five dependents."

""attempts last week win compromise bond issue larger dispute failed,"" james kinnear, texaco's president chief executive officer, told reporters. kinnear said pennzoil's disclosure court papers friday wanted extend bond issue hearing end april, pushed texaco towards chapter 11. pennzoil asked texaco post 5.6 billion dlr cash bond reduce dividend 50 pct earnings. pennzoil also wanted assurances texaco would sell assets, kinnear said. texaco offered put one billion dlrs letter credit agreed let value assets fall 11.1 billion dlrs, added. joseph jamail, houston attorney pennzoil, said company made latest settlement offer texaco saturday taken surprise texaco filed bankruptcy. declined reveal amount proposal, citing confidentiality agreement two companies. ,"west germany's capital market liberalization program stalled bankers worried may take years reforms completed. liberalization got underway may 1985 foreign banks received bundesbank permission lead-manage mark eurobonds. moves included introduction mark-denominated certificates deposit last year. changes, including revisions domestic options market introduction futures contracts, need lengthy statutory changes may take years, bankers dealers say. deutsche bank ag co-chairman f. wilhelm christians called last week enlargement current capital market instruments include instruments already standard abroad. said needed especially prices fall, citing declines west german share prices first two months year stock indices fell 20 pct. others blunt. securities dealers say lack viable hedging instruments shares bonds makes trading domestic markets risky. ""we need stock index futures contract, futures contract recent government bonds,"" one dealer said. west germany options contracts five pct shares bonds traded exchanges here, covering 30 pct average traded volume, stock market sources said. options written original 14 bonds selected bond options introduced last april. recent bond list issued 1985. futures exchanges west germany. german banks may participate futures exchanges branches abroad least outwardly subject stringent west german rules requiring every contract secured one-by-one basis separate hedge, prevent speculation. another problem lack liquidity existing markets, owing lack private investor participation. private individuals corporations engage options trading due west germany's civil exchange laws, define losses made futures options business gambling losses, investors need pay back. options business hurt lack liquidity pension funds, currently forbidden invest instruments. allowed enter business soon european community begins harmonize rules governing funds. manfred laux, general secretary west german mutual funds association frankfurt, said harmonized rules adopted october 1, 1989 latest. push adopt new instruments great past, owing wide-spread belief speculative, gives bad name west germany. pressure introduction growing. start-up swiss futures exchange bankers considering similar exchange would useful west germany. say without innovations, business could drift london, bundesbank vehemently opposes. official london international financial futures exchange (liffe) said exchange currently plans introduce mark-denominated contracts beyond existing mark-dollar contract. said exchange studying feasibility contracts, including one three-month mark interest rates possibly government bond contract. bundesbank capital markets expert said bundesbank objections hedging futures liberalization sector still early planning stages earlier talks ended two years ago. considerations futures business drawn large number participants involved talks. include parliament, bundesbank, federal banking supervisory board, eight west german stock exchanges governing states, four west german banking associations. beyond options futures, changes suggested include replacing federal government's current bond consortium auction procedure similar one considered u.k. already practice u.s. would upset existing market order providing german foreign banks consortium fixed quotas would eliminate misallocations bankers say presently arise within fixed consortium quota system. addition, bankers would like method bond trading west german stock exchange changed system continuous price-setting current system every bond price fixed day. would make trading transparent reduced proportion off-floor interbank bond trading, 90 pct volume bond transactions here, bankers say."

""we would like business administration court hague ask luxembourg court justice whether dutch grain commodity board, levy collection agency, interpreted levy regulations correctly, also whether regulations may contravene european law,"" pex said. ""it great regret taken route, political help, therefore option even though could take years,"" pex added. het comite asked chv act test case grain levy bill company received commodity board included grain wide variety origins therefore considered best general basis legal challenge levy, pex noted. het comite's actions run tandem questions levy already posed luxembourg court case brought association european animal feed manufacturers, fefac."

,"euro-medium term notes, recent phenomenon international capital markets, hardly attracting flood issuers investment bankers best breath life market. medium term notes (mtns) met staggering success u.s. market total outstandings grown around 50 billion dlrs since 1983, year took hold new financing vehicle bridge gap commercial paper longer term bonds. convinced stay, investment bankers attempting adapt mtns euromarket. ralph bunche, vice president morgan stanley international, predicted recent euromoney conference mtns become predominant instrument raising funds late 1980's 1990's. ""it (the mtn market) even surpass bond market,"" said. bankers took exception degree mtns grow. generally agreed instruments provide borrower greater flexibility lower costs traditional bond. trick convincing european borrowers worth arranging program and, accomplished that, persaude european investors -- whose preferences differ u.s. counterparts -- buy securities. discussions bankers proved one thing. one exactly sure proceed structuring marketing issues. date 13 euro-mtn programs announced activated, unit pepsico inc another ab electrolux. several firms devised different structures euro-mtns defend structures adamantly. pepsico notes, example, sold continuously offered basis. involves small amount new notes similar maturities constantly offer current market rates. electrolux program uses multi-tranche tap notes devised merrill lynch. structure, initial tranche minimum 50 mln dlrs fixed rate interest maturity. borrower issues additional notes category pre-determined maximum. defend continuously offered method, wendy dietze, salomon brothers inc vice president, point flexibility offer interest rate maturity. furthermore, believes structure offers european investor greater confidence market liquidity -- major concern buyers. merrill lynch europe ltd's kevin regan defends medium-tranche tap notes concept saying offers comparable liquidity. also said structure may right option borrowers. peter mortimer, partner law firm milbank, tweed, hadley mccloy, noted legal requirements could well determine structure chosen. noted tap system allows clearly defined ""lock-up"" period tranche specific maturity. case notes issued u.s. borrowers, ""lock-up"" period 90 days completion series time security cannot sold back u.s. u.s. investors. however, said securities exchange commission reviewing current regulations ownership foreign securities u.s. citizens softening rules could come distant future. part borrowers say feel bit like guinea pigs. petter skouen, executive vice president nordic investment bank (nib), noted weeks ago nib would said disappointed euro-mtn program, success recent issue changed minds. conceded retrospect would wiser establish separate programs euromarket u.s. domestic market, rather try extend u.s. issue globally. nib's 200 mln dlr program, 100 mln sold u.s. 25 mln europe."

""because texaco filing, investors bid paper mid-60 area (around 650 dlrs per 1,000 dlr face value) around 95 friday,"" said dealer high-yield, low rated bonds. ""but sellers could found levels bids soon rebounded 75 85 area,"" added, referring issues texaco's 13 pct notes 1991, 13-1/4s 1999 13-5/8s 1994. mid-90s friday. rebound occurred standard poor's corp downgraded debt ratings 8.4 billion dlrs debt texaco subsidiaries d, traders noted. p cited weekend bankruptcy filing. agency said uses grade securities issued companies chapter 11 reorganization. moody's investors service inc followed suit, cutting debt texaco units caa. junk bond market experienced short-lived downturn last summer ltv's bankruptcy filing sparked worries credit conditions steel companies would also worsen. informal underwriting arrangement auctions bank encourages gilt-edged market makers, part commitment market, participate actively auction process."" bank originally believed favoured requiring dealers underwrite auctions, patterned u.s. treasury market. however, treasury believed baulked request 27 market makers allotment commission would discourage largest institutional investors placing orders new stock directly bank england, thus denying primary dealers best customers. commission would passed along customers place orders via primary dealers, making less expensive buy go directly bank. market sources said bank had, discussions dealers upcoming auctions, agreed allotment commission reasonable dealers concurrent commitment buy auction regardless market conditions. indeed, bank gilts dealers believed disappointed treasury agreed go along plan. however, paper, bank suggested conditions applied first auctions may abandoned modified future sales gilts prove inefficient unwieldy. among items document, bank said first auction consist 1.25 billion stg conventional short-dated stock maturity seven years less. subsequent auctions held 1987-88 financial year would first one billion stg long-dated stock maturity 15 years longer one billion stg medium dated stock seven 15 years maturity. remainder gilt-edged funding program would met traditional tap offerings stock via government broker. protect buyers newly auctioned stock, bank agreed establish so-called fallow period, 28-day period agrees issue new stock type, necessarily resume selling stock fallow period expires. event prices offered stock sold substantially line market conditions, bank agree take stock onto books. bank would free sell stock fallow period price minimum tender price. bank also said least initially, auctions alloted bid price basis, system bidders allotted stock price bid. however, bank said reserves right limit money market maker buying 25 pct single auction. bank widely believed concerned preventing single market maker cornering stock drive price up. bank repeatedly signalled intention prevent dealers cornering market stock, issuing additional stock, occasion, end market shortage. bank also agreed publish information auction results soon possible sale complete, widely expected day. information released include amount stock allotted terms competitive non-competitive bids, highest, lowest average price successful bids."

""but interested sometimes different making bid,"" blair said. transcanada pipelines ltd <trp> yesterday bid 4.30 billion dlrs dome, dome said discontinuing talks transcanada considering proposal another company also talking another possible buyer, rumored offshore. asked reporters dome remain canadian hands, blair replied, ""yes. think still need building much canadian position industry think would best dome ends hands canadian management."" said know possible bidders were. blair said move put dome's financial house order ""will remove one general problems attitude hung western canadian industry."" added, however, energy industry still faced ""a couple tough, tough additional years."" asked nova's 1987 prospects, blair predicted nova's net profit would rise year 150 mln dlrs last year's net profit 100.2 mln dlrs due improved product prices continued cost-cutting."

orange,"u.s. international trade commission, itc, voted authorize commerce department impose anti-dumping duties imports brazilian frozen concentrated orange juice. itc voted 3-2 favor anti-dumping petition final ruling matter. today's itc ruling consistent commerce department's final ruling march 9, activates anti-dumping duty 1.96 pct imports brazilian frozen concentrated orange juice, stephen vastagh, itc investigator said. itc found brazilian orange juice imports injured u.s. producers. commerce department already ruled imports unfairly priced, lowered 1.96 pct anti-dumping margin preliminary decision last fall set 8.5 pct, vastagh said. u.s. government requiring bond posted imports brazilian frozen concentrated orange juice since commerce's preliminary ruling last october 23, said. commerce ruled one major brazilian producer -- cutrale -- would excluded anti-dumping duty. brazilian imports account 40 pct total u.s. supply, vastagh said. december 1985 november 1986, united states imported equivalent 546 mln gallons brazilian orange juice worth 622 mln dlrs, said. currently, united states requires 35-cent per gallon tariff orange juice imports, vastagh said. itc spokesman said agency would forward final report anti-dumping case commerce april 22. commerce process anti-dumping order transmit u.s customs, liquidate bond entries dating commerce's preliminary ruling begin assessing duties, vastagh said. said 12 brazilian orange juice exporters, including three major shippers, would affected decision."

crude,"u.s. oil traders said texaco inc's filing protection chapter 11 bankruptcy code adding uncertainty already skittish oil market, opinions divided impact market. ""the filing holding wet barrel trading today,"" said one trader. ""everyone talking it, assessing company's situations relation texaco,"" added. traders said companies deal texaco concerned whether receive payment supplies bankruptcy filing. however, others less worried. ""the first paid trading community connected texaco shipping industry,"" one new york trader said. ""if texaco get crude supplies can't run refineries, assets would worth anything,"" added. texaco filed protection chapter 11 u.s. bankruptcy code yesterday failing reach settlement pennzoil 11 billion dlrs court award illegally interferring pennzoil's proposed purchase getty oil co. however, others less worried. ""the first paid trading community connected texaco shipping industry,"" one new york trader said. ""if texaco get crude supplies can't run refineries, assets would worth anything,"" added. texaco filed protection chapter 11 u.s. bankruptcy code yesterday failing reach settlement pennzoil 11 billion dlrs court award illegally interferring pennzoil's proposed purchase getty oil co. ""there reluctance trade texaco great change,"" said another trader, adding traders tending toward prudence dealings company. traders assessing whether require cash prepayment letters credit, continue trade usual texaco open line basis, said. another trader, however, described today's activity business usual, adding traders feel secure liens put texaco's assets bankruptcy. traders said apparent effect texaco filing crude futures trading although said exchange might lower texaco's position limit require higher margins texaco's trades. new york mercantile exchange president rosemary mcfadden declined comment texaco's futures trading, saying proprietary information. mcfadden say, however, matter procedure, possible exchange lower allowable position limits increase margin requirements companies financial trouble."

bop,"south korea decided major changes trade, investment finance policies aimed reducing growth balance payments surplus avoiding trade war united states, deputy prime minister kim mahn-je said. kim told reporters excessively fast rise exports could make south korea reliant exports, increase nflation produce trade friction. policy shift, means abandoning seoul's goal rapidly reducing foreign debt, worked series ministerial meetings. kim, also economic planning minister, said current account surplus, previously expected exceed eight billion dlrs year, would held five billion dlrs increasing imports, accelerating market liberalisation rationalising exports. said seoul would try limit current account surplus around five billion dlrs year next years, although trade volume would continue grow. ""this gradually reduce ratio surplus gnp (gross national product) current five pct level three pct 1991,"" added. koo bon-yong, aide kim, said south korea's foreign debt expected fall 40 billion dlrs end 1987, initial forecast 41.8 billion, 44.5 billion dlrs end-1986. ""but (with policy changes) debt expected remain 40 billion dlrs, although could still lower originally projected 41.8 billion dlrs,"" said. policy change announced two days scheduled arrival u.s. commerce secretary malcolm baldrige talks trade minister rha woong-bae. south korea u.s. pressure reduce bilateral trade surplus, rose 7.4 billion dlrs last year 4.3 billion dlrs 1985. kim said policy changes also prompted swing south korea's current account surplus 2.06 billion dlrs first quarter 1987 deficit 438 mln dlrs 1986 period. first quarter 1987 exports rose 36 pct 9.4 billion dlrs. government would make foreign currency loans worth 2.5 billion dlrs firms willing import capital goods, raw materials equipment, preferably u.s., said. ""the foreign currency-based loans, carry interest 1.5 points libor (london interbank offered rate), considerable incentives given increase imports,"" koo said. koo said loans would repayable foreign currency. ""it means could become interest-free loans korean currency continues rise value,"" said. said south korean would revalued dollar gradually, added ""we believe rapid one-shot changes value won."" won, fixed 839.70 dollar today, risen six pct dollar since beginning 1986."

,"international banks radically changed attitudes towards debt lending debtor nations explore new methods ensuring inflows, philippine central bank governor jose fernandez said. ""commercial banks tended rather difficult terms new money time now,"" told reporters news conference. ""within world enormous changes taking place attitudes different banks."" said banks longer flush funds post-1973 oil boom reluctant lend money. ""they kind money used ... find whole deposit base eroding,"" fernandez said. groups major banks decided international arena liking. ""they wind 7/8 (over eurodollar rates) wants 7/8 really? nothing. want get frills, big enough get frills."" philippines wednesday announced wanted renegotiate debt restructuring accord reached march 27 12-bank advisory committee, saying wanted terms granted argentina earlier week. argentina granted 19-year repayment 13/16 points eurodollar rates, historically low spread mexico last october, philippines, insisted deal similar mexico's, restructured 10.3 billion dlrs 28.2 billion dlr foreign debt 7/8. fernandez said old type new-money agreement, hundreds banks forced involuntary lending advisory committee negotiated agreements debtor countries, becoming increasingly difficult. said involuntary lending proved useful two three years since mexican debt crisis 1982. ""but present tendency banks, specially regionals small ones, either sold portfolios simply policy put money,"" fernandez said. said another disturbing development so-called national quota approach adopted groups banks. ""groups banks nationality chosen take look groups banks countries willing let us say british banks wind giving 99 pct needed u.s. banks give 92 pct, british banks say whole pull out,"" said. ""there banks decided lending good business more. want deal securities, want go investment banking, want go turnover business rather carry business,"" fernandez said. ""we thread way constellation banks, different objectives."" said order survive, philippines would try stimulate new types inflows, ""whether direct investments, whether investments institutions chosen lend invest, whether debt equity conversions."""

trade,"basic reform japan's protected farm sector key shifting economy away export domestic-led growth, vital step trim trade surplus, securities analysts said. farm sector, protected import tariffs quotas, propped subsidies price supports, sheltered tax system, ample room change, said. ""in economic terms, reform would plus,"" said christopher chew brokerage firm james capel co. ultimate cost existing system food prices twice europe two three times u.s., analysts said. spending food accounts one quarter average household's budget roughly 10 pct gross national product (gnp), according study chew. reducing prices could increase household spending power five pct, study said. money could spent products would direct impact boosting domestic growth, added. ""there's lot slack,"" u.s. government official tokyo said. ""all money could spent something else."" direct central government subsidies farm sector amount five billion dlrs per year. independent estimates put total subsidies sources high 37 billion analysts said much money wasted. changing tax laws encourage city residents farm weekends put land sale residential development would also give boost domestic spending, economists said. ""housing construction key strategic variable expansion domestic demand,"" wrote chihiro nakajima, professor kyoto gakuen university. japanese business groups calling staged farm reform shift burden trade friction economic restructuring away manufacturing sector onto farm sector. employers groups also want change. ""if really want expand domestic demand, way raise wages recklessly, reduce commodity prices,"" bumpei otsuki, president japan federation employers' associations told recent press conference. external pressures rising u.s. europe seek removal tariffs quotas help reduce trade deficits japan. vested japanese interests opposed change remain well entrenched, dimming prospects quick reform, analysts said. although full-time farm population falling signs ldp paying attention urban constituencies, ruling party remains heavily dependent farm votes rural areas. one rural vote worth several city votes due pattern constituency borders. ldp already political trouble tax reform plan want raise another sticky issue soon, analysts said. consumer groups politically weak tend accept traditional view higher prices small fee pay national food security, said. powerful agricultural cooperatives fiercely opposed import liberalisation, flexible reforms aimed stepping productivity, said. reform, comes, response specific pressure rather all-embracing program, said chew."

japanese goods recommended curbs special panel experts headed u.s. trade representative's office. reagan announced last march 27 would impose tariffs certain goods taken list ranged computors television sets power tools photographic film. panel week winnowed list 20 products sent recommendations yesterday santa barbara, reagan vacationing. march annoucement, reagan said ""i committed full enforcement trade agreements designed provide american industry free fair trade opportunities."" added tariffs would lifted japan honored pact signed last year end dumping semiconductors world markets opened home market u.s. products. u.s. officials said japan done nothing since march announcement alter reagan's plan invoke sanctions. white house spokesman marlin fitzwater said yesterday: ""we want trade war, feel kind action requires meaningful action."" reagan's move follows steadily rising u.s. trade deicits, last year's hitting record $169.8 billion. one-third deficit trade japan. congress acq,"french finance ministry said today public flotation offer opening coming tuesday 39 pct capital <banque industrielle et mobiliere privee> (bimp) set 140 francs per share. offer closes next friday. ministry said statement 51 pct bank's capital sold solid core large investors, including insurance companies michelin subsidiary spika, 145 pct public offer price. ten pct shares reserved employees, get five pct discount increased 20 pct keep shares two years. employees also get one free share one bought, shares held least one year. small investors would receive one free share every 10 bought, upper limit five free shares per investor, condition shares held least 18 months. state-owned capital bimp comprises 2.51 mln shares. bank sold public part sweeping programme privatise 65 state-owned groups five years. separate statement, ministry said last week's privatisation offer 1.07 mln shares <banque du batiment et des travaux publics> (btp) 65 times oversubscribed."
interest,"white house budget chief james miller said concerned federal reserve might ""overreact"" decline value u.s. dollar raising interest rates, move said could cause recession next year. ""our greatest danger overreaction,"" miller told newspaper reporters yesterday. ""i'm concerned fed's overreaction. i'm concerned see recent data showing substantial fall money supply."" edwin dale, miller's spokesman, said remarks, published new york times today, accurate. miller said concerned fed might overreact signals rising inflation tightening credit -- move said could ""political consequences."" white house budget chief appeared referring effect economic slowdown could presidential congressional elections next year. ""my fear get recession deep soup, question it,"" said. miller said economic slowdown could lead lower tax revenues widening budget deficit. miller's remarks reflected concern u.s. central bank might feel compelled tighten credit means bolstering dollar. treasury secretary james baker federal reserve board chairman paul volcker recently warned declines value u.s. dollar could jeopardize global growth prospects. u.s. officials urged japan west germany stimulate economic growth countries -- move could boost u.s. exports relieve trade protectionist pressures united states."

""new progress expected main sectors except capital goods production remain present level,"" report added. upbeat report comes wake grim march trade balance figures showed deficit industrial trade first time since june 1982. automobile industry remained unchanged previously boosted levels, consumer goods production grew expected accelerate except area domestic appliances. semi-finished goods showed clear increase sectors. construction civil engineering, boosted rise public works, also improved, retail trade sales sectors continued slow."

""we expect complete package quickly,"" said telephone interview. providing share 1.55 billion dlrs new money raised argentina via easily tradable bearer bond instead participation syndicated loan, smaller banks could avoid time-consuming legal paperwork. bonds, currently dubbed ""alternative participation instruments,"" would carry terms syndicated loan - 12-year term, five years' grace interest rate margin 7/8 pct eurodollar rates, gonzalez said. idea ""exit bond"" creditor bank may exchange five mln dlrs existing debt new, tradeable bond bears below-market interest rates. return accepting lower yield, amount debt converted subtracted bank's exposure purposes calculating contribution future new loans. gonzalez said difficult say many banks would take ""exit bonds"" instrument offered before. paper, however, argentina's lending syndicate could shrink dramatically 100 country's 350 creditors exposure less five mln dlrs. details ""exit bonds"" still finalized, gonzalez added. argentina pressed hard streamlining lending process bitter memories last package, agreed citibank-led steering committee december 1984 signed august 1985. gonzalez praised committee cooperation latest negotiations said resulting deal, announced banks wednesday, put argentina road meeting economic goals. ,"senior u.s. bankers seeking calm furore philippines caused terms argentina's new financing package, source new york close manila government said finance minister jaime ongpin mood compromise. ongpin angry banks granted argentina interest rate spread 13/16 pct, mexico won, weeks telling philippines must accept 7/8 pct mexican margin could never repeated. bankers acknowledged political sensitivity interest spread urged ongpin examine argentine package entirety. argentina, instance, offering banks 3/8 pct participation fee sign deal within 30 days (declining 1/8 pct banks commit within 60 days), boosts all-in interest rate paying package. ""you make case deal 13/16 pct,"" one banker said. another, referring philippine debt negotiators, said ""the reason they'd come back new york political, economic."" ongpin said much himself, estimating extra 1/16 percentage point would cost 5.1 mln dlrs year. source close philippines said ongpin's anger goes beyond dollars. said minister feels personally betrayed bankers insisted mexico's 13/16 pct rock-bottom spread could duplicated. top u.s. treasury federal reserve officials said same. source said ongpin unlikely come u.s. press case expecting philippines' bank advisory committee, headed manufacturers hanover trust co, negotiate spread reduction telex. ongpin said philippines unilaterally start paying interest lower rate made clear committee telex prepared pay mexico argentina, source said. ""the philippines really means business this. think there's much room compromise,"" said. manufacturers hanover declined comment issue. philippines last month agreement reschedule 10.3 billion dlrs debt 17 years interest rate 7/8 pct, whereas 30 billion dlrs old argentine debt stretched 19 years spread 13/16 pct. bankers said forced break word political circumstances changed past weeks. particular, said become clear argentina serious threat suspend interest payments unless got good deal. fearing argentine moratorium would stiffen resolve neighbour brazil, already suspended payments, banks, urging reagan administration, bowed argentina's demands. u.s. bankers argued that, regardless politics, rich menu options argentine package makes attractive enough justify 13/16 pct rescheduling rate. ""when (the philippines) see whole package, may realize mexican deal,"" one banker said argentine agreement. argentine pact contains several features mexican accord ""exit bonds,"" option provide new money via bearer bonds, trade facility, onlending provisions debt-equity conversion scheme. moreover, argentina requesting 1.95 billion dlrs new loans, compared mexico's 7.7 billion, paying 7/8 pct money instead 13/16 pct charged mexico. line argument cuts ice filipinos, note drily asked new money all. ""the banks reacted level politics argentina try justify terms economics, they're going problems philippines venezuela,"" said source close manila government. easter holidays bankers yet got official reaction venezuela, also paying 7/8 pct 20.2 billion dlr rescheduling. acknowledged caracas, also told mexico spread inviolate, quite likely demand lower spread. bankers sanguine case chile. fire human-rights record, government general augusto pinochet unlikely attract attention seeking renegotiate recent debt package, carries interest one pct, bankers said. hope that, tempers cool, philippines also accept reopening agreement took 4-1/2 tough months negotiate trouble worth."

trade,"tough trade sanctions president reagan imposed japanese exports shot across japan's bow also sign reagan attack unfair trade practices worldwide, u.s. officials said. robert crandall, trade specialist brookings institution, think tank, said ""a shot across bow often result shot stern."" said left united states open retaliation. u.s. officials said 100 pct tariffs reagan ordered 300 mln dlrs worth japanese goods also show congress tough pro-trade stand taken existing laws, new protectionist legislation needed. past year tough trade action taken european community corn sorghum, taiwan beer wine, south korea counterfeiting copyrights, patents trademarkets japan tobacco. white house spokesman marlin fitzwater told reporters tariffs - five pct - seen ""serious signal"" nations need fair trade practices. reagan said imposed sanctions certain computers, television sets hand tools japan honor agreement end dumping semiconductors world markets less cost open markets u.s. products. tariffs placed items available sources would little effect american consumer, fitzwater said. reagan come heavy pressure take tougher action - especially japan - end global unfair trade practices reverse growing u.s. trade deficit. alternative not, congress would. u.s. trade gap last year record 169.8 billion dlrs, continues rise, japan accounting one-third america's overall deficit. two-way deficits - canada, west germany, taiwan south korea - reagan officials said president ready fight all. reagan said announcing sanctions today ""i regret actions necessary,"" health vitality u.s. semiconductor industry essential american competitiveness world markets. ""we cannot allow jeopardized unfair trading practices,"" reagan added statement california vacation home santa barbara. said tariffs would remain force japan abided agreement. u.s. officials say action today show congress - write trade bill like - already tools needed fight unfair trade. white house aide said tariff action, ""it done appease congress, unfair trade practice."" aide added, however, ""on another plane, example administration uses trade law fight unfair practices, necessary make major overall trade laws."" analyst, crandall, said tariff action best interests united states, negotiations pursued resolve issue. ""it's dangerous go retaliatory route,"" said, ""because leads retaliation restrictions trade."" crandall said, ""the administration political impact across country, therefore impact congress."" said, ""i think makes lot sense."" analysts said made little difference whether tariffs aimed u.s. trading partners congress, main point trading partners notice retaliation weapon reagan ready use. spokesman fitzwater said ""we want trade war,"" imposition sanctions showed united states would act evidence trade pacts violated. crandall said, ""the administration political impact across country, therefore impact congress."" said, ""i think makes lot sense."" analysts said made little difference whether tariffs aimed u.s. trading partners congress, main point trading partners notice retaliation weapon reagan ready use. spokesman fitzwater said ""we want trade war,"" imposition sanctions showed united states would act evidence trade pacts violated."

,"securities exchange commission reminded securities dealers mark-up disclosure requirements also applies transactions zero-coupon securities. dealers brokers required u.s. securities law disclose mark-ups excessive, sec said public notice. further, excessive mark-ups securities transactions, whether disclosed not, violate rules national association securities dealers inc municipal securities rulemaking board, said. separate action, sec filed friend-of-the-court brief private civil case involving complaint merrill lynch excessive mark-ups zero-coupon bonds. case appealed u.s. appeals court. lower court dismissed complaint, finding antifraud provisions securities laws prohibit undisclosed excessive mark-ups securities transactions. sec urging appeals court reverse decision, citing nearly 50 year-old position undisclosed excessive mark-ups securities dealers violate general antifraud provisions securities laws."
