money-supply,"u.s. banking data released today distorted draw sweeping conclusions monetary policy, support market's assumption federal reserve started tighten grip credit, economists said. ""it's clear fed firmed somewhat. discount window borrowings, net free reserves, fed funds rate average pattern reserve additions consistent modest tightening,"" said dana johnson first chicago corp. johnson, several economists, estimate fed funds rate trade 6-1/4 6-3/8 pct. discount window borrowings week wednesday 935 mln dlrs day, producing daily average two-week statement period 689 mln dlrs, highest since week december 31, 1986, 393 mln dlrs previously. moreover, banks forced borrow huge 5.2 billion dlrs fed wednesday - highest daily total year - even though unexpectedly low treasury balances fed day left banks two billion dlrs reserves fed anticipated. however, economists said almost certain fed aiming much lower discount window borrowings witnessed week. pointed two factors may forced banks scramble reserves end week. first, economists expect m-1 money supply week ended april 29 rise staggering 15 20 billion dlrs, partly reflecting parking checking accounts proceeds stock market sales mutual fund redemptions pay annual income taxes. banks' checking-account liabilities rise, reserves required hold deposit fed. required reserves indeed rise sharply 2.5 billion dlrs day two weeks ended wednesday, economists said fed may believed magnitude projected m-1 surge late week started add reserves late. second, apparent shortage treasury bills apparently left wall street dealers little collateral enagage repurchase agreements fed, economists said. thus, although 10.3 billion dlrs repos outstanding wednesday night, fed may wanted add even reserves prevented so. ""it's inconceivable fed add much wanted shortage collateral,"" said ward mccarthy merrill lynch economics inc. mccarthy estimated fed targetting discount-window borrowings 400 mln dlrs day, equivalent fed funds rate around 6-3/8 pct. citing reasons fed probably tightened credit degree suggested data, economists said fact fed delayed arranging overnight injections reserves last day statement period good sign restrictive policy. jeffrey leeds chemical bank convinced fed tightening policy. reviewing today's figures, said, ""it's fair say fed may moving toward slightly less accommodative reserve posture."" leeds expects fed funds trade 6-1/4 6-3/8 pct said fed unlikely raise discount rate unless dollar's fall gathers pace. johnson first chicago agreed, citing political opposition washington dollar-defense package time congress sees dollar depreciation key reducing u.s. trade surplus japan."

,"rising interest rates protectionist trade policies prompted new push latin american nations win debt relief, regional foreign finance ministry officials said here. officials cartagena group 11 debtor nations met week draw new proposals reaction called deteriorating world panorama, citicorp's decision create reserves third world loans. (see ecra spotlight headlines) ""we looking trade, interest rates financial flows.....in order put forward basis permanent solutions,"" mexico's public credit director angel gurria said. recent developments led moves summit latin american presidents debate new solutions. ideas include schemes link debt payments trade, proposals stable interest rates. latter proposed letter week cartagena g-7 leaders due attend summit venice month. another idea include debt gatt negotiations, cartegena ministers yet endorse proposals. speaking earlier new york, uruguay's foreign minister cartagena group chairman enrique iglesias said citicorp's decision could discourage new lending. might help cartagena's bid old new debt treated separately. cartagena group, met ministerial level year, wants repay debt contracted debt crisis low interest rates prevailing 1970s. would pay new loans current market rates. ""many countries fear gained months arduous debt negotiations lose stroke one point rise interest rates,"" one official said. ""the new increase interest rates come precisely thought still come enough,"" iglesias said. latin american officials also concerned varying interest spreads granted different debtor nations could generate discord, philippines' recent protest given less favourable terms argentina. speculation venezuela would demand cut 7/8 pct spread, public finances director jorge marcano said plans renegotiate terms. week's meeting came three latin american presidents meeting montevideo called stable interest rates region's 380 billion dlr foreign debt. called review developments since last ministerial meeting february 1986 think new ideas. since last ministerial meeting advances, mexico's growth-oriented 77 billion dlr loan refinancing package agreed last september. also setbacks, like brazil's payments moratorium. loans expected baker plan materialized debtors forced browbeat reluctant banks. ""we clearly stretched restructuring process limits question go here?"" senior mexican foreign ministry official said. existing debt strategy based nursing debtor economies back position service debts qualify new loans. five years economic adjustment, latin american debtors currently unable raise voluntary credits, exception colombia. venezuela paying back principal. countries prospect paying debts foreseeable future. citicorp made clear decision move three billion dlrs reserves mean writing-off loans. latin american officials said citicorp's move would probably boost trading discounted third world debt secondary market, implicitly downvaluing amount owed. said might make new lending even remote. discounted debt bought foreign investors debt-equity schemes generate new resources debtor economies. chile mexico currently front-runners field, latin american officials see schemes limited panacea overall problem. latin officials set greater store building export income debt-equity schemes. exports hit 97.7 billion dlrs 1984, cutting region's debt service ratio 36 pct, fell 78.3 billion last year. so, even though interest rates dropped ratio hardly changed. cartagena group called debt-trade link recognized before, made detailed proposals. officials said initiatives discussed would submitted foreign finance ministers 11 nations, imf world bank annual meetings later year."
trade,"use tariffs quotas reduce flow foreign goods united states little cut nation's swelling trade deficit, government study said. fact, federal trade commission (ftc) report said, protectionist policies could make u.s. products less competitive world marketplace raising cost imported products re-exported different forms. ""such policies much likely hurt, rather help, productive capabilities u.s. economy,"" said. 218-page report, written ftc economists john hilke philip nelson, blamed rising trade shortfall, climbed record 166.3 billion dlrs last year, shifting currency exchange rates growing u.s consumer demand. factors commonly blamed deficit, foreign trade practices, deteriorating u.s. industrial competitiveness, high labour costs government restrictions mergers, added little problem, said. ""although industry's competitiveness affects level imports exports industry, general find significant industry-specific changes affecting competitiveness would explain increase overall trade deficit,"" study said. ""to extent government action needed deal trade deficits, policies focus economy-wide phenomena exchange rates relative economic growth,"" ftc study said. supporting conclusion broad-based economic shifts cause increase trade deficit, report said found nearly u.s. industries lost domestic market share foreign competitors 1980s. also said found ""fairly direct relationship"" increased trade deficit influence shifting currency exchange rates, u.s. economic growth domestic demand goods services, outpaced foreign consumer demand. study examined seven factors commonly blamed trade deficit: foreign government subsidies trade barriers protect foreign industries, lack investment u.s. industry, declining research development u.s. industry, high labour costs, union work rules, oil prices rises 1970s u.s. antitrust regulations. case, study found little evidence factor impact trade deficit."

""we intention revising terms accord,"" said. ""venezuela restructured debt repaid 7/8 pct, think better countries,"" said. rescheduling accord covers 90 pct venezuela's commercial bank debt, accounts 90 pct total public sector external debt. venezuela almost debt outstanding multilateral agencies. marcano said attempting revise rescheduling accord second time would probably hurt venezuela's bid restore credit rating raise new loans. said venezuela obtains trade credit lines without government guarantee, something argentina others starting try negotiate restructuring packages. venezuela currently seeking loans japan west germany finance steel aluminium expansion. according finance minister manuel azpurua, 100 mln mark credit lined venalum aluminium plant. marcano said mandate yet given planned 100 mln dlr bond issue, although confirmed talks continuing morgan guaranty banks. banking sources said one option privately place bonds caracas-based banco de venezuela, would underwrite issue, marcano said decision yet made."

""production surging ahead originally planned, demand growing slowly envisaged months ago,"" said. said opec look carefully level production third quarter would effectively sustain 18 dlrs price, increase originally envisaged might soften price levels. 13-member cartel scheduled meet june 25 vienna review december accord prices output. ""i hope opec follow conservative attitude terms volume decisions,"" lajous said. repetition happened last year, opec boosted output sent oil prices tumbling 10 dlrs, always possibility, said. ""i hope never go trauma 1986. expect oil exporters learned lessons discipline maintained,"" said. lajous said still excess supply long remains tendency instability oil markets, prices remain around 18 19 dlrs 1987 output remains control. said saudi king fahd's remarks last month, increased production important long incomes would affected output, ""very relevant welcome powerful producer."""

cocoa,"dutch cocoa processors unhappy intermittent buying activities international cocoa organization's buffer stock manager, industry sources told reuters. ""the way operating moment almost nothing support market. fact could said actively depressing it,"" one company spokesman said. including 3,000 tonnes acquired friday, total amount cocoa bought buffer stock manager since recently began support operations totals 21,000 tonnes. despite buying, price cocoa well 1,600 special drawing rights, sdrs, tonne level bsm obliged buy cocoa market. ""even started operations, traders estimated manager would need buy least 75,000 tonnes maximum prices moved 1,600 sdr level, yet appears reluctant so,"" one manufacturer said. ""we hoped manager would move market buy 75,000 tonnes fairly short period, simply step back,"" added. ""the way manager nibbling edge market moment actually depressing sentiment market everyone holding back buying selling waiting see manager next,"" one processor said. ""as long buying tactics remain market likely stay doldrums, see indication alter methods,"" added. processors chocolate manufacturers said consumer prices cocoa products unlikely affected buffer stock buying time come."

acq,"computer associates international inc's 800 mln dlr merger uccel corp <uce> eliminate strongest rival, company still faces stiff competition international business machines corp <ibm>, wall street analysts said. ""ibm still ruling force mainframe systems software,"" said scott smith, analyst donaldson lufkin jenrette. ""but combination two companies clearly present much stronger front,"" said. besides ibm, ""computer associates far away powerful company field,"" added e.f. hutton analyst terence quinn. field segment market known system utilities, software packages boost productivity company's data processing facilities increasing speed, power efficiency large mainframe computers. merger uccel computer associates combines two biggest systems utilities suppliers ibm. analysts said remaining players mostly small firms find competition much harder past. computer associates, merger uccel caps six-year acquisition campaign vaulted garden city, n.y.-based company top software industry. deal completed sometime august, company's revenues exceed 450 mln dlrs, pushing past microsoft corp <mfst> world's largest independent software vendor. computer associates founder chairman charles b. wang took company public 1981, since bought 15 companies boosted annual sales 18.5 mln 309.3 mln dlrs year ended march 31. liemandt took charge wyly, sold non-computer businesses decided would focus solely mainframe computer software. 1984, company renamed uccel corp. liemandt, said leave company merger completed, also turned acquisitions growth. last day 1986, uccel completed buyouts six companies total 60 mln dlrs. 1986, earned 17.0 mln dlrs, 1.01 dlrs share, sales 141.5 mln dlrs. agreement took industry analysts surprise, largely companies bitter rivals. also, dallas-based uccel engineered strong comeback dark days 1982, when, wyly corp, lost 7.7 mln dlrs, 56 cts share. time, wyly owned potpourri 13 different businesses, three involved computer software. 1983, walter haefner, swiss financier major wyly investor, lured gregory j. liemandt away job chairman general electric co's <ge> computer services unit. computer associates' wang uccel's liemandt said news conference merger would give computer users single source wide range software products. addition system utilities, computer associates also sell products microcomputers, uccel made inroads applications software market, analysts said successful accounting banking systems. wang said computer associates would continue support enhance companies' product lines, noted company eventually weed duplicate offerings. said 20 pct companies' products overlap. analysts said merger would dilute holdings current computer associates shareholders 10 pct. joined wang forecasting deal dilute computer associates' earnings current fiscal year. quinn e.f. hutton said wang proven track record completing acquisitions without earnings dilution. therefore, said would change 1988 earnings estimate 1.05 dlrs share. wang said would look closely combined operations two companies cut duplication sales, marketing research development. analysts said computer associates paid premium uccel. based friday's closing price, company swap 47.50 dlrs worth stock uccel share, nearly 33 times uccel's 1987 estimated earnings 1.45 dlrs share. stephen t. mcclellan merrill lynch research said software companies currently valued 20 times per-share earnings. analyst said uccel worth premium earnings potential customer base. wang said haefner, swiss investor, would hold 25 pct computer associates stock merger. currently owns 58 pct uccel. executive said merger would alter target maintaining sales earnings growth 30 pct 35 pct. addition, october 1985. dealers also want see acceptable foreign metal new market sort demand develops forward deliveries. also view among european traders that, proposed kuala lumpur tin futures market would provide another useful reference point, market inaugurated malaysian government -- past viewed major player times trade -- would make participants uncomfortable. traders expressed preference resumption trading london metal exchange, added behind scenes discussion subject definite move unlikely outstanding high court litigation actions resolved. spot tin prices european free market currently around 4,200 stg per tonne high grade metal warehouse rotterdam. past 18 months price moved ten year low 3,400 stg march 1986 rebounded high 4,680 stg december 1986. compares 8,140 stg last paid lme trading ceased october 1985 record high tin price 10,350 stg traded cash standard grade metal june year. lme warehouse stocks near two-year low 28,065 tonnes, fallen steadily record high per tonne 1987. however, trend reversed following strong upswing sterling versus dollar values fell back briefly 4,100 stg last month approaching 4,700 stg december. decline accelerated producers sold little metal higher levels became competitive sellers. also lack significant demand major steel mills made large purchases prior new year. traders say 15 itc creditor banks' original tin holdings itc-related holdings halved overall tin position. analysts see immediate sign rally european tin prices movements still expected largely related currency fluctuations, unless significant consumer demand emerges third quarter. association tin producing countries, atpc, made efforts since collapse ita achieve higher world prices attempting bring major producers export control umbrella, date money-fx,"venezuela's central bank ordered venezuelan banks exchange houses cease foreign exchange operations brokers based outside country, according copy central bank telex made available reuters. measure, confirmed brokerage firm here, effectively cut foreign participation venezuela's volatile currency market. telex, issued may 19, signed carlos hernandez delfino, manager bank's department international operations. telex said restriction business foreign brokers line earlier measure prohibiting foreign exchange houses selling dollars foreign currencies anyone living outside venezuela. recent weeks venezuelan government denied rumours intends impose foreign exchange controls prop weakening bolivar. brokers said central bank's move seen de facto currency control. ""it definitely control sense there's longer complete freedom operate,"" one broker said. ""gradually they're imposing restrictions direction towards complete control,"" broker said. broker, requested anonymity, said virtually venezuelan customers stopped business since central bank issued telex followed telephone calls. said restriction imposed volume firm's transactions venezuela 10 mln dlrs day. ""it frenetic market, really quite active,"" said. broker said saw logical explanation prohibition firm acted act intermediary venezuelan brokers, exchange houses banks. ""we buying dollars venezuelans, that's ridiculous,"" said. ""they've rampage foreigners."" broker noted two months ago venezuela's central bank quietly announced banks foreign exchange business outside venezuela would respect new 200 pct reserve requirement. february, central bank also prohibited trading bolivar futures, broker said. ""we used forward market,"" said. ""for small currency miraculous."" said bolivar, averaged 20.29 u.s. dollar 1986, would continue slip current range 28.35 28.50 central bank rapidly running foreign reserves support currency free market."

gnp,"philippines' first quarter growth figures released yesterday indicated government likely achieve 1987 targets, central bank governor jose fernandez said interview. national economic development authority (neda) announced yesterday gross domestic product (gdp) grew 5.78 pct gross national product (gnp) 5.53 pct first quarter year earlier. ""i see anything horizon cut (growth) short,"" fernandez said. neda said gnp grown 3.56 pct gdp 3.25 pct fourth quarter 1986 year earlier. last year's gnp growth, put earlier 0.13 pct, revised 1.51 pct. ""certainly see shortage external resources gnp growth continues level would assume domestic resources fiscal side would generated would stumbling block,"" fernandez said. ""i think even figures came out, simply looking key indicators, consumption fuel oil power, showed economy different track last year,"" said. fernandez said consumption tended heavier first second quarters dry weather, could drop third quarter. said significant sign recovery lay manufacturing sector, grew 9.64 pct, declines 1985 slow turnaround second half 1986. ""that seasonal thing, secular,"" said. said government met monetary targets set first quarter consultation international monetary fund (imf). expected draw fourth tranche 198 mln sdr stand-by arrangement soon. philippines far drawn three tranches totalling 58 mln sdrs arrangement expiring april 23, 1988. fernandez said imf mission would visit july august review performance january-june period. said imf repayments projected total 1.56 billion dlrs 1987-92 period drawings 236 mln dlrs. repayments inevitable many countries would find net repayments imf rising next years. ""it means since net drain oda (official development assistance) accounts commercial banking system requested hold line,"" said. internal constraint exists imf debt cannot rescheduled, fernandez said. philippines rescheduled 10.3 billion dlrs 28 billion dlr foreign commercial debt march. fernandez said central bank bills, introduced march 1984 mop excess liquidity, peaked 43.1 billion pesos april 1986. unwinding maturity dates, started october last year, almost completed. said auctions treasury bills, whose outstanding level touched 95.44 billion pesos may 20, going well. ""treasury bills remain basic monetary tool,"" said. commenting country's foreign debt fernandez said, ""i think philippine debt stock looms large receipts exports taken kind leap forward might suitable."" foreign debt projected central bank reach 29.04 billion dlrs end 1987. neda said exports totalled 1.2 billion dlrs first quarter, imports 1.4 billion dlrs. fernandez said government targeted gnp growth six 6.5 pct year. cautioned growth far high targets yet achieved. fernandez said saw merit arguments economists peso, currently pegged 20.50 dollar, ought devalued make country's exports competitive. ""by pegged dollar basket basis peso already substantially devalued country's trading partners,"" said. proposed omnibus investment code, said opposed clause would allow unrestricted repatriation abroad investments made first two years imposition code. imposition code, scheduled last january, delayed objections business groups. ""i think central bank, certainly one events past two two half years, prudent. time throw caution winds i'm that,"" fernandez said. ""it would ideal reach point movement capital earnings free,"" said. ""we one year reasonably good results. certainly continue fairly heavy drain external availabilities simply servicing debts."""

money-fx,"currency dealers karl otto poehl scourge speculators, bankers man played key role shaping world's financial destiny last seven years, germans guardian mark. president powerful independent west german central bank, bundesbank, poehl likely contract renewed another eight years expires end year, government officials say. (index economic spotlights, see page ecra) official announcement yet made, raising eyebrows west germany's business community. ebullient poehl spent seven years bonn top ministerial posts social democrats, opposition, moved bundesbank. speculation chancellor helmut kohl would try replace poehl man closer christian democrats. officials noted poehl worked closely successfully finance minister gerhard stoltenberg since kohl's government took office 1982. poehl, senior central banker apart paul volcker united states, enjoys strong international reputation would take newcomer years build up. given circumstances, kohl probably overlook poehl's past adviser former social democrat chancellor willy brandt, top aide helmut schmidt finance minister, bankers said. schmidt who, chancellor, appointed poehl present job 1980. recent months, mark's strong rise dollar, poehl made exchange rates central concern bundesbank's council, highly conservative institution doggedly pursued monetary policies prevent inflation catching hold. older germans remember two bouts galloping inflation century. consumer prices falling much 1986, inflation negligible far year, poehl thinks safe relax monetary reins little concentrate dangers german economy bloated exchange rate. ""i opinion efforts stabilise dollar/mark rate reached high priority, also bundesbank, massive revaluation mark would endanger economy west germany,"" told business journalists frankfurt recently. ute geipel, head research citibank ag, says poehl's reappointment would guarantee flexible monetary policy. ""poehl's policy always policy focus rigidly domestic factors, also external economy,"" said. economist german bank, declined identified, said ""if poehl confirmed post, certainly plus pragmatic course rigidly oriented towards money supply."" one poehl's great struggles recently persuade united states stop ""talking down"" dollar. poehl, significance february louvre accord united states agreed join efforts stabilise currencies. louvre accord greeted scepticism currency dealers said would soon put test. fact dollar relatively stable since pact. ""this markets know - perhaps know - central banks do,"" poehl says intervention currency markets quickly turn rates round, making speculator's position worthless. poehl born 1929 worked financial journalist 1960s starting ministerial career. relaxed sun-tanned figure enjoys cracking jokes glass beer, hardly stereotype central banker. also keen sportsman likes watch football play golf. poehl says currency market intervention cannot substitute correct economic policies exchange rates imbalanced. ""but achieve enormous effect small amount strike right moment,"" said. bundesbank dealers professional skilled. ""they've burnt fingers many people,"" said. unlike speculators, poehl notes, bundesbank dealers usually make profit."

sugar,"china increase sugar imports substantially year foreign exchange constraints large stocks, despite falling production rising domestic demand, traders official press said. ""despite rapid increases domestic production last 30 years, imbalances supply demand continue extremely serious,"" farmers daily said. said 1986 plantings fell due removal crop incentives, farmers could earn crops technical seed improvements widely disseminated. official press estimated 1986/87 sugar crop (november/march) 4.82 mln tonnes, 5.2 mln year earlier, domestic consumption six mln tonnes year. yunnan 1986/87 sugar harvest record 521,500 tonnes, provincial daily said. gave year-earlier figure. output guangxi 1.04 mln tonnes, new china news agency said without giving year-earlier figure. nanfang daily said production guangdong province fell estimated 1.92 mln tonnes 1.96 mln area sugar dropping. ""supply cane (in guangdong) inadequate,"" newspaper said. processing costs rising economic situation nearly mills good. guarantee supply cane major problem."" western diplomat said sugar output also fell n fujian, south china's fourth major producer, drop area planted. said rural sectors guangdong fujian wel developed, enabling farmers choose crops according maximum return, meaning many avoided sugar. farmers daily said peasant ortheast province heilongjiang could gross 108 yuan one mu (0.0667 hectares) soybeans 112 yuan one mu corn 70 one mu sugarbeet. paper said profit margin mills china fell 4.7 pct last year 11.87 pct 1980. mills lacked capital modernise competed raw materialsx, added. resulted falling utilisation rates big, mode{nised mills. price sugar changed 20 years, official press said. customs figures showed china imported 1.18 mln tonnes sugar calendar 1986, 1.9 mln 1985. diplomat said stocks end-august 1986 2.37 mln tonnes, 1.92 year earlier. foreign trader said china accumulated large stocks 1982-85 provincial authorities allowed import sugar authority. practice stopped 1986 central government resumed control imports. ""as china lacked storage, much imports stored qinghai, inner mongolia inland areas,"" diplomat said. trader said transporting stocks areas consumers east south china problem, particularly coal priority. ""how quickly move sugar one factor determining import levels,"" said. another factor quality harvest cuba, china's major supplier barter trade, said. ""china bought two distress cargoes last week, 152/153 dlrs tonne,"" added. ""china desperate buyer now. cuban harvest bad, go open market."" japanese trader said peking's major concern regarding imports price. ""while foreign trade situation improved year, foreign exchange restraints persist,"" said. diplomat said domestic demand rising five pct year ""a communist government much better position regulate demand capitalist one, foreign exchange situation demands it."""

money-fx,"taiwan's central bank announced today overseas foreign exchange borrowings local foreign banks would frozen level reached end may. central bank's statement added measure would effective end july. bankers said measure designed curb inflow foreign exchange slow growth money supply. added move, sparked record single day plunge local stock market, would limit ability lend foreign exchange importers exporters. foreign exchange borrowings local foreign banks reached almost 12 billion u.s. dlrs end april, according official statistics. last week central bank said today would reduce purchase forward u.s. dollars banks 40 pct 90 pct value contract. said move needed ""distortions"" foreign exchange market. exporters, nervous appreciating taiwan dollar, heavily selling forward u.s. dollars interbank market avoid exchange rate losses. official figures show forward u.s. dollar sales may reached record almost six billion u.s. dlrs 5.9 billion april. taiwan's foreign exchange earnings must converted local dollars, boosting money supply time booming exports. money supply rose seasonally adjusted 51.86 pct year end-april, raising fears higher inflation. march central bank clamped tight restrictions remittances foreign exchange companies individuals taiwan move curb inflows speculative money. economists bankers estimate rising value local dollar attracted ten billion u.s. dlrs speculative money taiwan since early last year. flowed mainly hong kong, japan u.s.. since september 1985 taiwan dollar risen 22 pct u.s. dollar. bankers said government's efforts stabilise foreign exchange market prelude lifting curbs capital outflows. central bank said controls dropped end july early august. foreign exchange dealers said today's announcement caused jitters market foreign local banks making heavy purchases u.s. dollars. said central bank sold 30 mln u.s. dlrs. taiwan's stock market plunged record 75.53 points close 1,803.08."
reserves,"britain's gold currency reserves rose record underlying 4.76 billion dlrs may, following april's 2.9 billion dlrs increase, treasury said. underlying trend indicates level recent bank england intervention currency markets curb sterling's strength. market expectations rise one billion three billion dlrs. treasury declined comment figures. actual reserves rose 4.87 billion dlrs may, compared april's 2.8 billion increase, total value 34.68 billion dlrs, compared 29.81 billion end april. borrowings exchange cover scheme 238 mln dlrs, april's 66 mln. repayments scheme 85 mln dlrs, 90 mln previously, capital repayments eight mln, three mln last month. repayments government debt amounted 33 mln dlrs. underlying reserves increase net borrowings repayments. larger previous record 3.04 billion dlrs rise seen october 1977. may increase represents seventh monthly rise, reserves 9.947 billion dlrs period, 9.816 billion since start 1987."
,"world bank's policies prevent lending money transfer land landowners landless, help finance development philippines' proposed land reform program, bank official said. ""the world bank established policies cannot use resources finance transfer assets one group another. mandate finance investment-related activities,"" rolando arrivillaga, bank's resident representative philippines, told reuters interview. arrivillaga said wanted clarify part report world bank mission came march review land reform program said bank would able finance compensation payments transfer land. said philippine government never asked bank finance land transfers, bank's position taken mean ruled lending program. ""clearly case land reform question land transfer definition transferring assets landed landless,"" arrivillaga said. ""however, bank institution finance development aspects program."" ""we deal part program deals put land effective use transferred make on-farm investments needed attain goal improving income level beneficiaries,"" arrivillaga said. ""i surprised multilateral institutions faced similar constraints,"" said. president corazon aquino's spokesman said last week committed launching program, limits land holdings seven hectares, using sweeping powers rule decree new congress convenes july. presidential spokesman teodoro benigno said land reform program, estimated cost 44 billion pesos, would implemented four phases benefit 2.64 mln farmers. benigno said first two phases would complete transfer rice corn lands abandoned farmland well transfer land sequestered, expropriated foreclosed government would cover 1.15 mln hectares. aquino would decree redistribution large sugar, banana coconut plantations, leaving congress work details, benigno said. arrivillaga said bilateral aid donors, form part consultative group led world bank, might prepared finance land transfers. ""i think fast easy rules international sources finance would behave situation like this, land reform nature requires rich financing able carry reform way equitable landowner beneficiary,"" said. arrivillaga said first priority government would tap domestic sources financing land transfer, external assistance could brought gaps. ""in fundamental reform test willingness government confronts domestic resource requirement,"" arrivillaga said. ""multilateral agencies nature lenders last resort. means convinced government prioritises program."" said world bank financed developmental costs earlier land reform program launched former president ferdinand marcos 1972, aid channelled land bank philippines (lbp). lbp main implementing agency aquino's program. ""if asked program designed improve standard living poor would certainly prepared consider (lending),"" arrivillaga said. said tendency programs exaggerate costs presenting ten-year perspectives one-year context. arrivillaga said government could solve financing problems devising effective instruments compensate landowners. finance secretary jaime ongpin said landowners likely paid 10 pct cash rest 10-year bonds 10 pct face value redeemable year. arrivillaga said instruments used compensate landowners freely tradable near face value added: ""the challenge devise system deferred payments good cash."" said international financing community watching philippine experiment great interest. ""they going interesting model many countries opened dialogue reforms every sector population even international institutions,"" said. ""i think they'll solid base make decision launch reforms."""

""i think again, would differently,"" said one source. conable, former congressman new york appointed president reagan senior position bank nearly year ago, taken view bank badly needed reorganized perhaps made streamlined. backing many reagan administration viewed bank bloated inefficient bureaucracy gave money countries free-market sources assistance available. however, bank singled much greater role u.s. debt initiative proposed treasury secretary james baker. strategy, called 20 billion dlrs new funding commerical banks nine billion dlrs spending development banks, mostly world bank, came profound doubt decision citibank chase manhattan set aside new reserves. move, heralded sources measure gives parties time, frightened others, see beginning tit tat exercise could lead complete unraveling monetary system. envisioned latter, next move would brazil, delayed payments debts, say intend pay interest long period time. citibank banks could decide stop financing country's export credits, funds countries use support daily activities, leading economic breakdown. ""within six weeks alot countries could business,"" said one source. citibank's initial step last month set three billion dlrs general reserve potential losses loans developing countries. followed similar move chase manhattan days later. best worlds, kind cooperation demonstrated international monetary fund (imf), multilateral development banks, wealthy countries commercial banks debt crisis surfaced 1982, could emerge one expecting that. anything, negotiations become much confrontational debtor countries pressing concessions, arguing face growing political instability asked pay more. critical imf's austerity measures sympathy view among development community. ""when hear code words like structural adjustment tightening belt. means poor peasent making 700 dlrs year drop 500 dlrs,"" says one source. adds: ""and hear market forces play, means level public services drop."" hoped giving world bank greater role debt strategy might defuse growing resistance debtor countries measures increased already prevalent poverty even further. bank, primarily assists countries building roads, sewerage systems, education, so-called infrastructure, viewed third world benefactor. imf, however, essentially forged debt stategy following disclosure mexico 1982 near default, considered stern taskmaster little sympathy even understanding poverty. doubts well baker initiative worked world bank's success bringing increased growth third world u.s. prescription indicated countries might grow way difficulty."

""we fit better monier,"" said. csr said concentrate development core businesses sugar building materials moves energy several years ago. asked thought etl's bid sought achieve, herbert said: ""i'm puzzled hawkins' strategy is. one wonder monier main target."" herbert said csr plans raise bid, said higher price would difficult justify fundamentals. monier trading 2.80 dlrs csr launched original bid 3.50, 16.8 times earnings, late april. shares closed 3.90 dlrs today, 25 cents yesterday, etl withdrew reaching top foreign shareholding level permitted without foreign investment review board (firb) approval. bid subject firb approval. herbert also said institutions, likely accept share alternative cash, would judge respective values etl csr shares. etl third group become involved possible acquisition monier year. redland held discussions possible takeover csr bid emerged negotiations foundered price. share analysts said reason, think etl's intervention would flush full redland bid although monier's ultimate fate rests hands. ""there's one burlington,"" said. ""if cannot get amount money compensate us."" greenfield also said samjens could sell holdings burlington 95 mln dlrs. ""we want that. we're money,"" said. irving nathan, burlington lawyer, reiterated information provided james ammeen, former burlington executive, crucial dominion's decision attempt takeover burlington. carcass,"former u.s. agriculture department official urged department require packages chicken labeled handling cooking instructions protect public disease. carol tucker foreman, president foreman heidepriem former assistant secretary agriculture food consumer services, told house agriculture subcommittee, ""every hour every day, 22 americans become victims chicken contaminated salmonella."" said every two half weeks, american dies salmonellosis complications arising incidence poisoning poultry increased steadily past several years. foreman said usda follow national academy sciences recommendation label chicken packages remind consumers preparation procedures necessary avoid illness. urged usda require birds washed thoroughly defeathered defeathering machines cleaned several times day, birds condemned intestines punctured visible fecal contamination chiller water changed often. kenneth blaylock, president american federation government employees, said poultry industry recommendation move away current bird-by-bird inspection could prove ""disastrous."" said strengthened bird-by-bird inspection slower line speeds foundation upon new inspection techniques overlaid."

""the promising japanese beef market could one bright spots u.s. agricultural exports,"" said philip seng, asian director federation. ""we supply (japan) buy high quality beef. like beef want buy more,"" said. seng pointed japan's beef quota system, limits total japanese beef imports 177,000 tonnes per year u.s. imports 58,400 tonnes, major constraint expanding u.s. beef shipments japan. quotas implemented 1977 time heavy japanese foreign beef imports. current quota agreement expires next march beef quota negotiations set get underway fall. reagan administration called end quotas april, 1988, japanese officials said would liberalize imports regardless u.s. pressure. officials meat export federation told reuters expect complete lifting quota, hope least gradual increase quota. high beef prices japan caused protected market also kept beef consumption modest levels, meat industry officials said. japanese shoppers pay average 27.14 dlrs u.s. tenderloin steak restaurant average 47.42 dlrs japanese-produced restaurant steak, meat association said. retail level, u.s. striploin sells 9.77 dlrs per pound, japanese beef sells 28.51 dlrs per lb. japanese consumers currently eat less 10 lbs beef per year, compared 78 lbs average american, officials said. total beef consumption japan 700,000 800,000 tonnes per year, seng said removal quotas decrease beef prices, consumption could increase 3.2 mln tonnes."

,"paul volcker's resignation federal reserve board chairman creates serious leadership vacuum time deep uncertainty future management third-world debt crisis, bankers said. said volcker official hold financial system together mexico halted interest payments august 1982 played central role ever since. ""where leadership going come from? suddenly there's terrible void,"" one new york banker said. volcker's expertise sorely missed international monetary fund managing director michel camdessus new job barber conable finding hard make mark world bank president, bankers said. moreover, volcker's successor, alan greenspan, little experience international affairs third world debt. ""greenspan sensitivity issues sense understanding complexity volcker has. volcker understands motivates people outside u.s. gut. greenspan intuitive feeling,"" one banker said. banker, discussed debt questions greenspan, described views simplistic. robert hormats goldman, sachs co said worried greenspan's lack international experience. ""people rush judgment, get know greenspan i'm sure they'll find excellent replacement,"" said hormats, former administration official. anyone nominated replace volcker would paled initial comparison, hormats said. ""volcker status financial demigod can't attain status overnight,"" said. one veteran debt rescheduler said volcker, together bank england, deserves credit keeping banking system intact mexico's default. ""if him, world would look lot different now,"" said. ""whether agreed not, superb grasp ideas."" certainly, bankers agree time volcker. particular, roundly criticized less forcing last september grant mexico generous terms 77 billion dlr new-loan debt rescheduling agreement. ""volcker lost lot credibility overstepping bounds pushing package onto banks,"" commented one banker helped negotiate mexican deal. another critic citicorp chairman john reed, said 13/16 pct interest margin would deter bank lenders thus delay mexico's return voluntary markets. review fate mexican deal - others followed chile, venezuela, philippines argentina - helped convince reed debt crisis solved citicorp needed bolster reserves case loans went bad. ""it certainly contributed general feeling malaise,"" one citicorp banker said describing impact mexican package bank's decision add three billion dlrs reserve possible loan losses. decision, since followed chase manhattan security pacific corp, may profoundly alter strategy creditors debtors alike tackling debt crisis. one sure impact be. ""it's difficult anyone know way debt problem going, volcker picture adds uncertainty,"" one banker said."
money-fx,"currency futures likely move higher following sharp rally today president reagan announced paul volcker would accept third term federal reserve chairman alan greenspan nominated replacement, currency analysts said. contrary predictions volcker resignation, analysts calling higher currency futures prices june 8 venice economic summit. particular, uncertainty greenspan's attitude dollar could undermine sentiment toward u.s. currency, analysts said. greenspan said today dollar appeared nearing bottom, market bear mind remarks chicago last week dollar's recent move upward technical reaction would trade significantly lower, analysts said. ""disappointment european central bankers appointment used opportunity sell dollar lower,"" said manufacturers hanover futures vice president carol mackoff. ""the international community like appointment,"" suggests possibility u.s. budget deficit much burden monetary policy volcker unable get commitment sought reduce deficit, added merrill lynch economics analyst david horner. furthermore, ""that greenspan named two months ago suggests administration's first choice -- status appointment bridesmaid,"" horner said. declining dollar scenario higher currency futures prior throughout venice meetings would mitigated concrete action opposed ""jawboning"" g-7 summit, said. g-7 finance ministers, judged recent statements, may impasse, analysts said. japan west germany today reiterated neither planned interest rate cuts, despite pressure u.s. so, mackoff said. u.s., hand, cut budget deficit japan west germany urged, said. g-7 members force u.s. commitment cut budget deficit next two years, decline dollar could forestalled, horner said. however, ""the impact venice nothing nothing changes,"" horner said. smith barney, harris upham co. analyst craig sloane said european currencies likely move higher end 1987 ranges today's sharp advance. next two weeks, sloan calls september yen futures advance toward 0.007200 area. said september marks could close 0.5700 upside target, swiss francs could climb range 0.6900 0.6950."

""the u.s. economy inevitably make adjustment necessary move deficit surplus trade balance order service growing foreign debt,"" told conference attended six members association southeast asian nations leading western friends. ""in view, happen rapidly many observers predict."" ""the universal strategy aggressive export-led growth becoming less effective,"" shultz said. ""it arithmetically possible every country world net exporter time. u.s. deficit, decry, sense place everyone's export-led strategy growth gone."" ""the huge surpluses japan (west) germany fed deficit, something give possibly traumatic experience,"" added. ""while must keep pressure us eschew protectionist policies, must act too,"" shultz said. ""i better job convincing congress leave door open imports trading partners open doors wider,"" told group, included representatives australia, canada, japan, new zealand european community."

""what minister said imply major economic policy change,"" ministry spokesman told reuters. ""but tried urge business circles prepare forseeable economic (future) ... high era."" south korean manufacturers, insisted rise seven pct year, said plan ask government slow appreciation dollar. bank korea today quoted unchanged 812.05 dollar, 6.02 pct gain far year compared 3.34 pct increase whole 1986. strengthened 6.60 dollar three days earlier month international monetary fund team held talks discuss revaluation."

interest,"belgian national bank said cut one, two, three month treasury certificate rates, 0.10 points, effective immediately. cuts take one month rate 6.75 pct, two month rate 6.80 pct key three month rate 6.85 pct, central bank said telex. national bank spokesman said modest cut made decline domestic money market rates yesterday, expected followed cut 7.60 pct discount rate. short-term treasury certificate rates, especially three-month rate, national bank's main monetary policy instrument last two years. discount rate market's penalty rate rather guiding rate since 1985, advances currently little used liquidity ample, bank economists said. bank last cut one- three-month certificate rates june 5, also 0.10 points."

crushing."" another demand fiji's 22,000 small farmers estimated 14 mln dlr loan fiji development bank (fdb) 1983 cane crop rehabilitation programme written off. fdb rejected request. ganilau said, coffee,"european coffee traders roasters may propose new formula calculating international coffee organization (ico) coffee quotas end meeting week, traders officials told reuters. although traders unwilling reveal details possible new formula, said would give brazil, world's biggest coffee producer, unchanged ico quotas next two years could basis renegotiation. ""the main sticking point quotas brazil's attitude, compromise could solution, "" one said. however, european coffee trade federation meeting, began today continue end week, revealed gaps european position re-introducing quotas. traders said that, whole, trade side re-introduction ico quotas, roasters generally favour single proviso formula basis re-allocating quota shares among producing countries. roasters said positions generally fairly close, problems government officials. germany italy cited extremes polarized government attitudes, countries fence. sources said germany extreme quota re-introduction, italians favour. ""nevertheless, expect find enough common ground end week least present common european community (ec) view next meeting consumer members international coffee agreement (ica) july,"" one trader said. ""we hope present compromise proposal consumer side, producer side accept it,"" one official said. ""we learned live without quotas suspended february last year, would prefer stability bring market long simply return old outdated status quo far quota allocation concerned,"" added. overall, however, trader roaster opinion likelihood successful re-negotiation mildly pessimistic, varying 50-50 chance 60-40 against. ""our main difficulty persuade u.s. consumer side brazil producer side agree quota re-introduction, "" said. ""the u.s. position has, anything, hardened, new brazilian coffee institute president adopted least negotiable position predecessors,"" one trader said. ""however, many producers starting swing favour consumer position quotas re-allocated new formula, brazil becoming increasingly isolated, gives least hope compromise ico quota meeting september,"" official said."

,"commitments argentina's external financing program 1987 1988 reached 91 pct 1.95 billion dlrs new loans banks asked provide, citibank argentina said joint statement. percentage close ""critical mass"" commitments international monetary fund requested condition releasing new loans country. senior citibank executive william rhodes said encouraged banks' response telexed commitments continue arrive. response argentina's 350 foreign bank creditors eagerly awaited package first marketed since u.s. banks, led citibank, decided take large second-quarter losses order boost reserves existing loans developing countries. bankers feared banks would refuse lend new money soon taking ""hit"" old loans, today's news delivers decisive rebuff skeptics. strong response package partly result inducement 3/8 pct early-participation fee banks agreed sign june 17, bankers said."
copper,"zambia's copper mining industry hoping achieve maintain production 500,000 tonnes year next years despite low world prices, deteriorating ores shortages mine inputs, industry officials said. zambia's decision abandon last may 1 tough international monetary fund (imf) economic recovery program introduced element uncertainty plans restructure ailing industry boost profitability, said. copper production government-controlled zambia consolidated copper mines (zccm) 1987 financial year ended march 31 improved slightly 471,000 tonnes record 1986 low 463,354 tonnes. ""we convinced end 1988 financial year, copper production could well 500,000 tonnes due greater availability spares equipment,"" zccm official said. zccm officials said production cobalt, another strategic income earner, also tailored meet demand. finished production 1986 4,565 tonnes, 911 tonnes higher previous year best production achieved date. protracted low world metal prices badly hit copper industry zambia, world's fifth biggest producer. mining monopolised zccm accounts 90 pct country's foreign exchange earnings. production also seriously affected recent years equipment breakdowns, deteriorating ore shortages spare parts, fuel lubricants. 463,354 tonnes output last year compared peak 1975 output 700,000 tonnes. five-year production investment plan launched 1984 zccm funded european community, african development bank world bank. plan foresees shutdown seven mining metallurgical units grounds unprofitable. zccm, second largest employer government, said intends lay 20,000 60,000 workforce part plan. 250 mln dlrs far channelled industry bid improve efficiency profitability five-year restructuring plan. company officials said although reserves depleted, zambia could continue produce copper beyond end century, though lower levels production. industry sources said zccm's projected pre-tax profit financial year ended march 31 would around 500 mln kwacha. current mineral export tax level levied, net loss likely registered. zccm recorded net loss 718 mln kwacha 1986 compared net profit 19 mln kwacha year before. foreign exchange auction system introduced 1985, zccm's profits foreign exchange earnings rose value kwacha fell 21 dollar two dollar. may 1, president kenneth kaunda abolished auctioning system, inspired international monetary fund, announced zambia would pursue go-it-alone economic strategy based national resources. zccm officials still cautious effects break imf industry's plans. ""we still consulting see new measures affect us early say shall fare new situation,"" peter hansen, director operations third zccm hierarchy, told reuters. analysts believe new officially-fixed exchange rate eight kwacha dollar hit zccm's export profits. ""most specialists talked tell break-even point zccm rate 10 kwacha per dollar,"" frederick chiluba, leader zambian congress trade unions said. high production costs continue bedevil zambian industry. zambia mines copper relatively expensive rate 69 cents per pound, compared 55 cents united states 40 cents chile. industry also faces transport problems due zambia landlocked. government confirmed year stopped sbending copper south south africa. 80 pct shipments, 35,000 tonnes month, sent rail tanzanian port dar-es-salaam, 5,000 tonnes go via zimbabwe mozambique port beira. transport often hit shortages wagons, spares fuel."

cotton,"west texas cotton crop largely unscathed isolated thunderstorm region last night packed hurricane-force winds, crop weather experts said. ""there might isolated storms, certainly nothing damaging,"" said charles stichler, extension agronomist agricultural extension service far west texas. rumors damaging storm west texas helped new york cotton futures market rally sharply morning. cotton december delivery 1.35 cents higher 70.95 cents lb midsession peaking morning 71.25 cents. ""what happened storm hit lubbock airport, happens, everybody sees it,"" said dale mohler, senior meteorologist accu-weather inc. lubbock heart west texas cotton region, produces 80 pct state's crop. storm produced winds 75 mph. ""that's hurricane force. isolated small portion west texas area, probably less five pct,"" mohler said. ""no doubt damage. hit july august (when fruiting would underway) would worse,"" mohler said. 60 pct west texas cotton crop planted, remainder could done weekend weather remains hot dry, stichler said. temperature west texas since mid-week 95 degrees. hot spell sorely needed far heavier normal rainfall several weeks, said."

nat-gas,"brooklyn union gas co, new york gas utility, see gas costs sharply result transco energy co's <e> decision close pipelines transport spot gas sales, energy industry analysts said. brooklyn union, fourth largest gas utility united states, purchased 36 pct supplies spot, non-contract, market 1986, proportion spot supplies estimated much higher five months 1987, analysts said. texas eastern pipelines <tet>, competing pipeline, deliver spot gas producing areas south closed gate station summer, brooklyn union relied entirely transco spot supplies. month may, brooklyn union paid two dlrs per mln british thermal unit spot gas, contract gas costs four five dlrs per mln btu, industry sources said. transco announced yesterday would longer provide open access transport spot natural gas customers fear accumulating take-or-pay liabilities. take-or-pay contracts oblige pipelines pay producers gas even delivery taken customers. brooklyn union continue receiving small amount supplies minor fields grandfather clause, brooklyn union official said. foster corwith, gas analyst dean witter reynolds, said rising cost booklyn union passed rate payers. net effect company known several months time lag deferred earnings, end-users, especially residential commercial customers, end paying gas, said. closure takes place summer months gas demand seasonal low, impact cash flow would small, curt launer, natural gas analyst donaldson lufkin jenrette, said. situation persists winter heating season, high cost gas could cut company's profits, said. gas utilities along eastern seaboard relying transco spot gas, north carolina natural gas co <ncng>, piedmont natural gas co <pny>, face high cost factor brooklyn union, steve richards, supply manager end users supply system, houston based natural gas brokering firm, said. ""but companies unwitting victims take-or-pay dispute transco producers,"" said. distributors turned deaf ear transco's request inventory charge, reserves pipeline facility spot gas delivered companies, said. without spot supplies, high cost system gas threaten drive away large customers capable shifting alternative fuels, said. absence guidelines inventory charges federal energy regulatory commission, matter negotiated pipelines customers, richards said. transco refused transport cheap spot gas them, distributors likely conciliatory inventory charge, said. ""cool heads prevail,"" dlj's launer said, "" may take while."""

trade,"u.s.-canadian ties could worsen two nations unable reach free trade pact, according study published two nonpartisan public policy research groups. cato institute washington fraser institute vancouver said removing remaining tariffs cross border trade would benefit countries. cato chairman william niskanen added ""the two nations' generally harmonious trade relations probably sustainable without new agreement."" united states canada, whose cross-border trade totaled 125 billion dlrs last year, holding talks since last june pact end trade barriers remaining two countries. u.s. put deadline talks october 1, sides said agreement likely despite tough bargaining remained. niskanen said pact reached, bilateral trade ties could deteriorate congressional pressure president reagan implement trade laws aggressively, could hit canadian trade practices. noted canada seeking foreign investment auto industry, could put strains considerable bilateral free trade u.s. canadian autos parts. niskanen also said canadian government vulnerable resurgence economic nationalism could restrict u.s. exports canada. free trade pact, backed president reagan prime minister brian mulroney, would open new markets canada enable industries achieve economies scale, would also help widen exports worldwide, said. would also increase gross national products countries. niskanen said goal pact end tariffs within 10 years, lower subsidies exports, set rules trade services investments, end curbs government procurement agree ways resolve trade disputes."
gnp,"strong growth domestic demand key feature economies southern european countries 1986, though growth seen slowing year next, organisation economic cooperation development said. semi-annual report, oecd said portugal's total domestic demand growth would decline 7.6 pct last year five pct 1987 3.75 pct 1988 slower wage growth restrained private consumption. turkey's economy grew much faster expected 1986 domestic demand surged 10.5 pct, growth expected halved five pct next year. spain, buoyant domestic demand, led fixed investment, driving force behind rapid growth gross domestic product. fixed investment private consumption expected ease 1988 would still remain strong. oecd forecast spanish imports would rise sharply next year, reflecting strong demand, entry european community declining competitiveness. greece, inflation forecast turn downwards following increase early year linked introduction value added tax surge food prices due cold weather."

tin,"thailand's major tin exporter producer <thailand smelting refining co> (thaisarco) said may unable meet overseas orders insufficient supplies tin concentrates thai mines. local mines cut combined daily tin concentrate sales thaisarco, royal dutch/shell group <rd.as> unit, less 20 tonnes earlier month previous 40 45 tonne average, commercial manager yoot eamsa-ard told reuters. said cuts resulted government decision let temporary business municipal tax reductions exported tin lapse june 3. taxes, levied tin mines, rose 4.4 pct month 1.1 pct ad valorem past year. lower levels introduced last year temporary move aid tin industry prices collapsed late 1985. yoot said thaisarco dig stocks meet large portion new overseas orders averaging 100 tonnes per day. result, said, thailand could fail fill 3,000 tonnes 19,000 tonne tin export quota allocated association tin producing countries (atpc) year ending february 1988. reduced tin exports year could cause atpc allocate lower quota next year, yoot said. supplies shortage prove temporary, however, thai cabinet expected review mineral resources department proposal reinstate low taxes late month, yoot said. department said thailand exported 7,715 tonnes tin january/may compared 8,462 tonnes year ago."

gas,"japanese oil companies starting campaigns market 100 octane gasoline meet growing domestic demand higher quality motor fuel, oil sources said. ten companies plan offer unleaded gasoline summer, starting <idemitsu kosan co ltd> june 20. showa shell sekiyu kk <shol.t> introduced formula shell 98 octane gasoline japanese market january year. formula shell achieved strong sales japan despite higher price regular octane gasoline, prompted oil firms offer rival product, sources said. ""we received good response consumers formula shell terms smoother ride effective fuel consumption,"" showa shell said. shell's product sells 145 yen per litre, 15 yen higher regular gasoline, already achieved 38 pct share japan's high octane gasoline market, said. high octane gasoline accounts 25 pct shell's total gasoline sales japan, added. idemitsu said hopes raise high octane sales 20 pct total gasoline sales seven pct, immediately launch idemitsu 100. nippon oil co ltd <npol.t> said launch 100 octane gasoline july 1, aiming increase high octane sales 20 pct six pct total gasoline sales. rush compete high octane gasoline market share spurred expectations government lift gasoline production quotas restrictions gasoline station construction next two three years. ""major oil companies trying boost gasoline sales network ahead proposed lifting gasoline production quotas,"" official major oil company said. advisory panel ministry international trade industry (miti) recommended week government press ahead deregulation oil industry, including lifting gasoline production quotas, help oil companies increase international competitiveness. japan's three biggest gasoline marketers, nippon oil, idemitsu showa shell, suffered supply shortages production quota guideline fiscal 1986, ended last march. domestic gasoline demand year 2.5 pct previous year, according miti report."

""barring market manipulations, good u.s. harvest 1987 could lead attractive prices, active trading reappearance u.s.a world's leading producer peanuts,"" said. overall exports china, leading exporter last year, remain exceptionally high levels year despite quality complaints difficulties implementing earlier high-priced contracts. early say china retain current market share 1988, tracomin said."

""we already agreement may need slight review,"" lukman said. agreement reached long session opec ministers december last year pegged group's crude oil output 15.8 mln bpd first half 1987 fixed prices around 18 dlrs barrel. since prices risen 15 dlrs december official opec levels, oil industry analysts firmly convinced organisation maintain agreement keep market stable. ,"sudan set aside 781.6 mln dlrs service foreign debts 1987/88, according budget plans presented parliament. compares 200 mln dlrs earmarked debt repayment year ending june 30. sudan foreign debt totalling 10.6 billion dlrs. finance minister beshir omar, presenting plans parliament last night, put budget deficit 2.88 billion pounds, 2.85 billion 1986/87. said budget would first four-year economic recovery plan announced end december. total set aside debt servicing, omar said 574.6 mln dlrs would go principal 207 mln interest payments. sudan annual debt liability 900 mln dlrs, khartoum-based western experts say. omar said last march would difficult, ""if impossible,"" sudan meet scheduled debt repayments 4.17 billion dlrs next five years. said last night sudan 2.6 billion dlrs arrears debt repayments first half year. experts say sudan owes 23 pct foreign debt western government creditors, 32 pct governments eastern bloc arab countries 21 pct commercial banks, rest owed multilateral sources. sudan, unable fully service debts since 1985 declared ineligible last year international monetary fund fresh loans, servicing creditors banned extending fresh loans recipients arrears. omar said government revenue 1987/88 would total 3.9 billion pounds. expenditure put 6.79 billion pounds. said budget deficit would fully covered loans, government deposits sources. omar said 375 mln pounds would spent subsidising sugar wheat flour prices 1987/88. said sudan's western backers witholding aid agreement imf reached. sudan, owes imf 450 500 mln dlrs arrears, scheduled hold fresh talks fund late july august reforming economy clearing arrears."

""but forget less year ago intervening support sterling temporary difficulty persuading markets one pct increase base rates, 11 pct, sufficient tightening policy time,"" added. base rate currently nine pct."

interest,"u.k. lenders offering homebuyers fixed interest rate mortgages borrower makes monthly payment matter happens interest rates. mortgage rates lowest levels years, loans snapped eager home buyers trying lock cheap money. decision offer fixed rate loans, industry officials said, reflects increasingly competitive nature home mortgage business. fixed rate mortgages uncommon u.k., mainstay business u.s. years ago. early 1980s interest rates soared. u.s. lenders, mostly savings loan associations, earning rates low three pct 30 year fixed rate mortgages held portfolios pay depositors rates high 15 pct induce retain accounts. result hundreds institutions collapsed forced merge. survivors decided offer mortgages whose rates would move line cost funds. ""we much example u.s. thrifts mind,"" said spokesman abbey national building society, explaining institution, time being, offering variable rate mortgages. rash advertising solicit new business helped homebuyers become even choosier loans lenders concede forced undercut still more. sharp cuts variable rate mortgages announced earlier week nation's two largest building societies national westminster bank plc reflect growing competition new business, officials three institutions said. fixed rate mortgages offer carry interest rates even variable rate loans. ""of course less profitable (variable rate) mortgages,"" said spokesman midland bank plc, earlier year said earmarked 500 mln dlrs fixed rate new mortgage loans. said bank willing offer less profitable loans because, ""it another way attract people mortgage product."" trustee savings bank plc (tsb) offering five year fixed rate mortgages 9.9 pct earlier year. 100 mln stg tsb set aside loans exhausted within days, according spokeswoman. ""everybody loves 10 pct mortgage,"" said, noting within five days bank loaned equivalent 25 pct 1986 volume. short, appeal fixed rate mortgages offer opportunity gamble direction interest rates. interest rates fall mortgage made lender earning average return assets. interest rates rise homebuyer benefit cheap money. household mortgage co planned offer 25 year fixed rate mortgage june 11 elections assumption conservative party victory would help money market rates fall further, according duncan young, managing director. young explained company planned protect chance rising interest rates buying complicated hedging instrument. money market rates risen contrary expectations company shelved plans time being. said money market rates high arrange mortgages hedge profitably. however, said household mortgage co make fixed rate mortgages likely securitise them. means bundling different mortgages together resemble bond selling investor. technical reasons securitisation simpler efficient fixed rate rather floating rate mortgages. u.s., fixed rate mortgages popular again, securitisation provided bulk mortgage money past years."

sugar,"cold wet weather northern, western central parts europe continued slow beet growth plant density reported good countries, sugar statistician f.o. licht said. temperatures low season rain hampered field work occasionally led water-logged fields. eastern southeastern europe, warmer weather boosted sugar beet growth. weather soviet union also allowed good beet development, licht said. sweden beet growth delayed, although plant population reported regular good. cool rainy weather slowed beet growth denmark crop prospects rated slightly normal. united kingdom ireland, rather cool heavy rainfall places delayed beet growth. france, belgium, netherlands, west germany, mostly cool frequent often heavy rainfall continued slow beet growth often made field work impossible. austria, warm rainfall, favourable beet growth, licht said. czechoslovakia poland, mostly warm, favouring beet development. heavy rain may caused damage. european beet growing regions soviet union, warm showers areas weather generally good emergence growth beets. south eastern europe, warm weather rainfall boosted beet development. labour trouble threatens beet crop spain. disputes factories trade unions threatening delay start processing southern areas, beets maturing early year."

,"paris club creditor nations agreed major rescheduling uganda's mozambique's government-to-government debts, club said statement. meetings week, countries accorded terms generous usually granted club. uganda given 15 years repay debts six-year grace period mozambique accorded exceptionally long 20-year period, 10 years' grace. club said approved countries' economic financial programs would therefore make contribution improve external payments prospects. said countries faced heavy debt service obligations low per capita income, adding solution countries' debt problems would take number years. statement also said mozambique's limited debt service capacity made borrowing international monetary fund upper credit tranches ""inappropriate."" details available countries' embassies club amounts involved, last week ugandan finance minister chrispus kiyonga said hoping rescheduling 120 mln dlrs. uganda's total foreign debt estimated 1.5 billion dlrs. french finance ministry statement issued time paris club statement, said france formally agreed gabon reschedule bilateral unpaid debt amounting 440 mln francs. bilateral agreement, covering payments due made may 31 year, follows paris club's january decision grant gabon extended repayment period government-to-government debt. ministry said french aid gabon 1987, within framework country's economic recovery program, amounts 1.67 billion francs."

""opec probably anything already agreed december oil prices firm,"" said john hill, vice president merrill lynch futures. opec agreed december maintain official oil prices 18 dlrs barrel raise group's production ceiling 16.6 mln barrels per day third quarter 18.3 mln barrels fourth quarter. agreement helped send prices sharply higher, rising 15 dlrs barrel early december. several opec members price hawks, including iran, algeria libya, seek higher official price reduction output. ""and u.s. west texas intermediate crude continues trade 20 dlrs barrel, greater chance opec raise official 18 dlrs price,"" said nauman barakat, analyst smith barney, harris upham co. analysts expect moderate producers, saudi arabia, block changes policy. ""the meeting non-event change official prices opec, particular saudis, committed stabilizing market,"" said rosario ilacqua, analyst l.f. rothschild. however, analysts said opec may need hold meeting september re-evaluate market conditions. overproduction opec become real problem fourth quarter quota raised 18.3 mln barrels day iraq's pipeline turkey brings another 500,000 barrels market day, said john lichtblau, president petroleum industry ressearch foundation. expect saudi arabia oppose price increase meeting many look increase year-end 20 dlrs offset decline dollar. oil prices denominated throughout world dollars, currency declines, producers receive less money oil. ""the real production restraint opec saudi arabia,"" said sanford margoshes, analyst shearson lehman brothers. ""in second half year expect saudis produce 4.1 mln barrel day quota therefore act vehicle stablize market pave way two dlrs barrel price increase december 1987 meeting,"" said. one uncertain factor course iran-iraq war. ""the wild card increased tensions persian gulf,"" said frank knuettel, analyst prudential-bache securites. oil tankers taking oil iraq kuwait regular targets iranian planes. reagan administration planning put kuwait tankers protection u.s. flag, naval escorts. ""the probability growth demand set massive investment required expansion - expansion viable south africa russia - leads conclude price platinum substantially underpinned medium long-term,"" clark said."

coffee,"european coffee roasters traders agreed propose new formula calculating international coffee organization, ico, quotas, dutch coffee trade association chairman chairman frits van horick said. van horick, council member european coffee federation, speaking end ecf annual meeting. new formula based six-year moving averages would give brazil, world's biggest coffee producer, unchanged quota remaining two years current coffee agreement, van horick said. accepted consumer producer members ico, formula could also basis negotiating new agreement, van horick said. coffee quotas suspended february last year prices shot fears drought-induced crop disaster brazil. although prices considerably lower, consumers producers unable agree re-introduction. ""brazil strongly change formula feared lower quota. proposal leaves little object to,"" van horick said. ""the existing quota system far rigid reflect supply demand reality,"" said. ""our formula builds flexibility system benefit almost everyone."" although full implications new formula still worked out, initial estimates suggest countries colombia, kenya, indonesia costa rica would get slightly higher quotas, others ivory coast, el salvador nicaragua would lose quota share, van horick said. proposal provides future quota distribution must reflect current demand actual supply, also prevent under-shipment quota countries would automatically prejudice following year's quota. ""if ico consumers accept proposal stands least fair chance accepted producers september meeting, generally favour new quota formula, "" van horick said. time much depend brazil's attitude. ""brazil increasingly isolated producer side. frost damage coffee crop next two months producers favour proposal, might get agreement,"" van horick added."
