acq,"president reagan's nominee top policeman nation's securities markets inherit agency challenged insider trading scandal, wild stock price gyrations host uncertainties stemming globalization financial markets. david ruder, 58-year-old republican law professor northwestern university evanston, ill., named thursday 23rd chairman five-member u.s. securities exchange commission. confirmed senate, expected, succeed john shad, left agency earlier week record six years chairman become ambassador netherlands. sec limelight past year investigators probed colossal insider trading scandal ever uncovered wall street. investigation, still active, mushroomed recent months growing number well known traders prominent investment banking firms charged wrongdoing. pace probe picked markedly november ivan boesky, one wall street's successful stock speculators, agreed cooperate government investigators pay record 100 mln dlrs penalties illegal profits charged insider trading. agency also wrestling vexing new phenomenon huge rapid swings stock prices, spurred computer-driven trading strategies span markets securities, options futures. price gyrations combined rising trading volumes bring unprecedented volatility u.s. securities markets. time, sec pressed lawmakers put stop abusive tactics corporate takeover contests unrelenting wave takeovers steadily reshapes u.s. corporate landscape. agency pushed u.s. foreign exchanges intent expansion lay regulatory groundwork international securities marketplace trading occurs across borders throughout world, around clock. worldwide trading networks offer vast new investment opportunities could strain sec's ability enforce u.s. securities laws guard investors fraud. leadership shad, sec eased financial disclosure requirements publicly traded companies, eliminated many minor investor protection rules, attempted spur competition among exchanges streamlined agency's review hostile corporate takeovers. shad, vice chairman e. f. hutton investment banking firm, brought wall street perspective agency upon named chairman 1981. line views top administration officials, favored marketplace determination takeover battles new federal regulations. sec shad also stressed prosecution insider trading violations corporate wrongdoing cases topped agency's enforcement agenda administration president jimmy carter, democrat. securities lawyers industry officials acquainted ruder say new chairman-designate unlikely significantly alter commission's current priorities. sec currently 2,000 employees, lawyers, annual budget 115 mln dlrs though figure likely significantly higher next year agency moves beef enforcement staff. agency one government actually taken money spent past years fees charges public companies, investment banks securities firms regulates. sec structured independent regulatory agency, meaning five commissioners appointed president fixed five-year terms protected firing policy differences alone. law, three commissioners may political party, agency prepares budget request year instead leaving white house. established congress 1934, sec traces origins great stock market crash 1929, attributed large part widespread trading credit attempted market manipulations large investment firms. agency requires public companies investment vehicles mutual funds issue periodic reports financial condition disclose changes condition time issue new securities. requires brokers, dealers investment banks register comply investor protection rules, polices exchanges regulates trading practices. first chairman joseph kennedy, industrial magnate also father john kennedy, later become nation's 35th president. former chairmen include william douglas, served 1937 appointment u.s. supreme court 1939, william casey, served president nixon's first term reagan's director central intelligence agency death earlier year."
trade,"administration asked congress replace u.s. tariff schedule new system bring line international tariff categories, u.s. trade representative clayton yeutter said. new system add items fiber optics accurately define new composites, items widely traded current schedule devised 30 years ago. yeutter said harmonized system, new schedule called, change tariff categories definitions meet present-day needs exporters importers, pay rates duties. yeutter said, ""american exporters find far easier deal one standardized worldwide system variety differing systems face."" said new system ended 12 years multinational negotiations create unified tariff schedule. yeutter said government business moves based data tariff schedules new system improve knowledge trade flows quality decision-making. said 56 nations pledged bring standards new system, half expected join system january 1988."

gnp,"economy faces lackluster growth risk recession year recent improvement u.s. exports falter, economists say. growth slow sharply next months due weakness key housing auto sectors could hampered unless consumer spending picks up, say. ""these factors raise question: enough strength keep economy tipping recession?"" said lyle gramley, chief economist mortgage bankers association former federal reserve board official. commerce department said week economy grew robust 4.8 pct annual rate first quarter, u.s. monetary official called weak report. housing starts fell 2.7 pct may, consumer spending rose weak 0.1 per cent. ""our two largest visible industries -- autos housing -- faltering, exports picking slack, "" martin mauro, senior economist merrill lynch economics, told reuters. gramley said worried consumer spending may slow inflation rising faster real wages. offset this, u.s. exports must continue rise, returning enough jobs manufacturing sector boost personal income consumption, says. ""i expect see enough improvement real net exports keep recession happening, close call,"" gramley said. federal reserve board governor martha seger told reporters apparent strength 4.8 pct growth figure result temporary buildup inventories last said recovery showing anemia. seger said recovery stumbling along, ""the pace economy lack robustness must factored monetary policy"" - possibly signal fed accommodative. economists predict growth slower 3 pct forecast reagan administration 1987 warn dollar drops suddenly, higher inflation result add risk recession. mauro said 0.5 pct rise industrial production may came despite cutbacks output auto industry, inventory overhang still exists. says boost production came smaller industries like paper, chemicals, lumber improved sales overseas due drop dollar. ""they going enough kind surge economic activity, think keep us recession,"" mauro said. speech financial planners week, beryl sprinkel, chief white house economic adviser, predicted trade deficit continue improve. ""prospects continued economic growth 1987 1988 still quite favorable,"" said. private economists raise concerns resurgence inflation. allen sinai, chief economist shearson lehman brothers inc., told congress week inflation would rise 4.5 five pct year stay level 1989 1.1 pct increase 1986. rise coming sharply lower dollar, higher oil energy prices rising prices services, said. ""the lesson history inflation genie gets bottle, continues persist,"" said, adding would like fed tighten credit. major factor affecting inflation value dollar, continue fall feed inflation, says prominent international banker. rainer gut, chairman credit suisse, told national press club dollar's downward trend yen mark continue years united states world's largest debtor nation. swiss banker said economic indicators point slackening activity called naive belief five-year boom world equity markets go forever. ""it difficult optimistic,"" gut said."

""interest rates declined approximately 50 basis points last month, largely indications inflation high people feared narrowing u.s. trade balance, nominal terms,"" samuel kahan, chief financial economist kleinwort benson government securities, said. kahan said recent government reports shown strength economy first quarter, concern whether u.s. economy sustain strength longer term. weak u.s. economic growth could hurt dollar, become important direction debt futures beneficial impact interest rates sluggish economy. median trade expectations tuesday's u.s. consumer price index durable goods reports 0.4 pct 1.5 pct, respectively. meanwhile, eight billion dlr drop m-1 money supply announced week ""surprising, much larger expected,"" according kahan. ""unless quickly reversed,"" trend ""will ensure june m-1 growth negative,"" kahan said. taken conjunction m-2 m-3 aggregates kahan said ""slowed crawl, federal reserve board annual targets,"" consequences could hint economic weakness road, said. based chart formations, t-bond futures may poised gains, although advance slowed recently, analysts said. september t-bonds ""are almost six points since may 18,"" merrill lynch debt analyst jim duggan noted. september bond futures climbed low 87 month ago 93 mid-june, duggan said. follow-through buying aided advance far, bouts short covering prohibited slide chart support, rally september t-bonds thwarted 93 level. ""the critical variable remaining market value dollar,"" kahan said. additional influences next week possible developments ahead opec members meeting, impact size u.s. budget deficit, ""although forefront market early next week,"" kahan said. looking ahead u.s. treasury mini-refunding auctions 24.25 billion t-notes tuesday, wednesday thursday, singer said market likely greet results little excitement. however, successful auction could prove turning point, depending prevailing market psychology."

crude,"following extracts communique issued conclusion opec conference here. ""the conference expressed satisfaction positive results agreement signed december, 1986, opec re-established system fixed price level 18 dlrs per barrel supported opec production ceilings distributed national production levels. ""the conference noted market indicators, including spot prices market netback values opec crudes, firming significantly, thus consolidating opec price structure defined agreement."" ""the conference examined supply/demand outlook second half year decided order secure continued firm prices market, opec production fourth quarter 1987 equal third quarter, i.e. 16.6 mln barrels per day (bpd), distributed national production levels defined above-mentioned agreement quarter."" ""furthermore, conference decided establish committee five heads delegation monitor price evolution market relation opec official prices order secure price stability around opec price structure. ""should significant change market prices, committee would immediately call extraordinary meeting conference view deciding necessary opec production levels second half year, would secure desired market stability."" ""the conference reiterated necessity member countries' strict adherence agreement signed december 1986, terms official price, national production, levels. ""for purpose, conference decided establish committee three heads delegation undertake visits member countries order motivate comply terms agreement."" ""moreover, conference stressed necessity cooperation oil-producing exporting countries outside opec essential prerequisite lasting market stability. conference, therefore, decided reinstate group five heads delegation established 77th (extraordinary) meeting conference april, 1986 undertake necessary contacts countries. ""the conference observed continued fall value u.s. dollar agreed matter studied reported next meeting conference."" ""the conference discussed appointment secretary general decided discuss matter next ordinary meeting. ""the conference extended term office fadhil al-chalabi deputy secretary general period one year october 7, 1987. ""the next ordinary meeting conference convened vienna december 9, 1987."""

crude,"opec output second half 1987, including iraq, official 16.6 mln barrels per day (bpd) output ceiling agreed opec saturday, kuwait oil minister sheikh ali al-khalifa al-sabah, said. iraq refused sign pact, opec maintained ceiling 16.6 mln bpd third fourth quarters 1987. december, opec set provisional fourth quarter level 18.3 mln bpd, cut back third quarter target. ali told news conference including iraq, ""opec third quarter output 17.5 17.7 mln bpd fourth quarter output nearly 18 mln bpd"" ali detail effect thought production levels would prices. iraq official first half quota 1.466 mln bpd, rising 1.54 mln second half, refused adhere recently producing around two mln barrels per day, exporting pipelines saudi arabia turkey. iraq's export capacity boosted 500,000 bpd oil pipeline via turkey comes stream september. iraq insisting quota equal gulf war enemy iran, quota 2.255 mln bpd, rising 2.369 mln second half. ali said position 400,000 bpd production neutral zone saudi arabia kuwait, supplied iraq war relief crude, fixed. ""we discuss it. change,"" said. ali said conference, began thursday ended saturday evening, short necessary problems adressed. ""we overdoing holding short meeting. sweep lot carpet,"" said. ali said problem price differentials prices various opec crudes dealt properly meeting. ali said ""the problem differentials real one. would hate producing today light crude problem dealt properly. light crudes overpriced relative heavy crudes."" asked issue differentials would raised next opec meeting held vienna december 9, ali said ""if crudes affected raise issue, work another minister."" kuwait's crudes range medium heavy grades. opec reintroduced fixed prices february 1, spread 2.65 dlrs barrel lightest heaviest crudes."

legal adviser failed promptly inform shareholders agency begun talks youngstown, ohio, shopping center developer edward debartolo response campeau's takeover offer. campeau acquired allied estimated 4.2 billion dlrs jan 1, following battle debartolo. sept 25, day allied disclosed board urged rejection campeau's sept 12 tender offer 58 dlrs share, allied began negotiating sale six shopping centers debartolo, sec said. allied legal advisor director george kern, heads merger acquisitions group new york law firm sullivan cromwell, decided amending allied's sec filing disclose talks even though resulted sales price 405 mln dlrs shopping centers, said. securities law requires takeover target companies promptly disclose things sale major assets. day campeau increased tender offer 80 pct allied's stock 55 pct raised bid 66 dlrs share 58 dlrs sept 29, allied partnership headed debartolo began negotiating takeover deal aimed thwarting campeau, sec said. kern decided disclosing talks amended sec filing, agency charged. allied's first disclosure debartolo takeover made oct 8, even though board approved merger oct 3 merger agreement executed oct 7, complaint said. debartolo campeau later engaged bitter battle control allied, campeau winning later october bought block 25.8 mln shares allied stock, 48 pct total, controversial move made minutes dropped hostile tender offer. acquisition additional 48 pct, federal judge allowed completed, gave campeau majority stake allied. campeau bought rest 69 dlrs share. sec said planned file court brief joining allied charging campeau engaged illegal tender offer. sec brief never filed since case dropped following agreement campeau debartolo. administrative proceeding allied kern, sec asking administrative order comply reporting provisions securities laws future. although allied longer publicly traded since became subsidiary campeau, still files annual quarterly reports sec outstanding debt."

""the estimated amount oil alba field around 320 mln barrels,"" paul spedding stockbroker kleinwort grieveson co told reuters. said industry estimates put total reserves field one billion barrels, given low gravity oil, recovery rate would expected around 20-25 pct. analysts said results encouraging, potential difficulty operating recovering oil field shown fact first well plugged sidetrack drilled. ""the field seems shallow widespread, require multi-platform development recovery, pushing costs up,"" christopher osborne stockbroker hoare govett said. analysts said although low gravity oil found would require additional costs recovery, test well showed flows well. ""although gravity oil field seems low, seems flow quite well around 300 mln barrels could recovered,"" carol bell phillips drew told reuters. however, chevron officials declined comment analysts' reserve estimates. said without research drilling area summer, would disclose reserve figures. analysts said field declared commercial developed, would ready local market heavy crude produced. ""most refineries upgraded refine heavy oils price differentials heavy light crudes lot narrower today,"" osborne said. chevron operates block behalf 16 companies include british petroleum development ltd, dsm hydrocarbons (uk) ltd, enterprise oil (tns) ltd, marathon int. pet. (gb) ltd phillips petroleum co u.k. ltd."

""if dollar falls steeply, happen yesterday, japanese investors definitely try withdraw significant funds u.s. shares,"" said akira kawakami, deputy manager nomura investment trust management co ltd's international investment department. unstable, lower dollar would also affect japanese investment u.s. bonds. ""japan-u.s. interest rate differentials, currently look wide enough, mean nothing absence dollar stability,"" said kawakami. u.s. bonds could benefit due gloomy economic picture following estimated huge losses stocks major u.s. institutional individual investors, said. effect rule u.s. interest rate rise. japanese investors u.s. bonds still wiating see dollar really stable, said. dollar holding firm 142 yen tuesday morning. ""although japanese investors sold huge amounts stocks new york yesterday, still looking chances lighten u.s. stock inventories,"" hiromitsu sunada, manager meiji mutual life insurance co's international investment department said. sales helped send wall street stocks 508 points 1,738, market's biggest percentage drop since 1914. ""but new outflows funds u.s. decreasing."" however, already evident three months ago, said."

coconut,"philippine coconut industry greeted relief defeat u.s. senate bill requiring edible oils labelled saturated fats. bill, defeated senate agriculture committee monday, could cost 60 mln dlrs year lost exports, philippine coconut authority (pca) said. ""naturally, welcomed defeat chance bill resurrected attached rider another senate bill,"" spokesman united coconut association philippines (ucap). pca chairman jose romero noted vote close, eight senators voting it, 10 one abstaining. ucap spokesman said american soybean association (asa) spent 25 mln dlrs lobbying bill. said asa also obscured health issue debate. ""coconut oil high saturated fats, unlike saturated animal fats, enter blood lymph systems leaving fatty deposits connected heart disease,"" said. u.s. soybean cottonseed producers argued saturated fats cause heart disease labels would discourage consumption health conscious consumers favour domestic unsaturated alternatives. opponents bill said proposal discriminated imports would damage philippines, malaysia indonesia. philippines earned 488 mln dlrs coconut products 1986, 477 mln 1985, ucap figures show. exports united states edible non-edible use account half total, pca's romero said."
interest,"plunging tokyo stock prices prevent bank japan raising discount rate could even force ease monetary policy collapse continues, government private economists said. rise interest rates would serve spark selling shares could ultimately major deflationary impact real economy, said. although bank japan officials consistently maintained plans raise 2.5 pct discount rate, many markets thought otherwise. fears rise discount rate fanned central bank's apparent decision last week countenance higher rates commercial bills, dealers said. today's stock market collapse -- prices fell nearly 15 pct -- means bank japan would hard pressed raise discount rate now, despite concerns renewed outbreak inflation, dealers economists said. japanese government bond prices rose sharply today markets concluded stock market's collapse precluded central bank carrying widely-rumoured discount rate increase. senior government economist suggested u.s. japan needed ease monetary policy prevent drop new york tokyo stock prices. ""they need support stock security markets,"" said. bank japan officials said saw need change policy moment, although one admitted central bank may rethink strategy tokyo stock prices continue plunge rest week. government bank japan economists agreed economy better placed cope deflationary impact plunging stock prices months ago. economy recovering strongly, steep drop stock prices likely put major dent consumer business confidence, one government economist said. ""there impact real economy, big,"" said another. individuals heavily invested stocks own, although participate trust funds investment vehicles. many manufacturing firms turned financial market investments profits last year's economic downturn, recent rebound allowed refocus attention core businesses, said. paradoxically, pick-up economy partly blame stock market collapse companies shifted funds away financial investments increase inventories step capital spending, one government economist said. deciding response make steep stock price drop, bank japan must first determine whether prices continue fall decide pose greater economic danger threat higher inflation, one central bank official said. ""that least take couple days, weeks,"" said."

""many sectors trade, including large roasters importers, adamant voluntary compliance past, subject tremendous irregularities became matter trade monitoring other,"" one analyst said. monday, national coffee association newsletter said office u.s. trade representative implement voluntary compliance system temporarily legislation monitor imports tied congressional trade bill. arrangement, milar one 1980, coffee importers would voluntarily present needed documents u.s. government congress approves monitoring authority, coffee arrives without valid certification, still allowed entry. many believe producers seek add overburdened stock situation u.s., others believe ship outside quota requirements lieu monitoring controls, trade sources said. ""last time, lot false information submitted customs resulted lot indictments fines,"" u.s. customs spokesman said. ""customs good job given tools, hands tied, authority demand form (documents tracking merchandise source destination),"" said. many see true test whether producers importers abide quota system. ""it key seeing whether teeth quota agreement,"" said one major u.s. roaster. ""last time gentleman's agreement, trade act gentleman,"" said another analyst adding, ""without need submit documents, ball producers' hands."" feel importers take advantage voluntary compliance due development two-tier market, non-member countries buy coffee big discount. many fear dealers buy coffee destined non-member countries discounts bring u.s. falsely labelled. according customs officials, several green coffee importers confessed 1985 imported coffee fraudulently buying non-member destinations, forging landing certificates relabelling navy beans. ""if there's much discrepancy prices one country another, producers may teted get rid stocks coffee selling non-member nations circumventing quota provisions,"" said paine webber analyst bernie savaiko. still, others believe producers hard pressed aggravate overburdened coffee stock situation u.s. near term. ""it would naive suggest agreement would share connivance, think voluntary system seemed suffice and, coupled fact much coffee, think poses much threat,"" one trader said."

""if not, going continued fear pressure emerges dollar, fed forced tighten. throws economic abyss recession u.s. obvious knock effects rest world."" economists added wall street's crash, dragged major markets it, may help curb problems sparked turmoil - namely world inflation fears massive persistent u.s. trade deficits. ""it would suicidal government context happened last couple days jack interest rates,"" added. stocks surged news chemical bank cut prime lending rate half point 9.25 pct tuesday u.s. fed chairman alan greenspan pledged support financial system. news eroded immediate fears stock collapse would spill economy, via banking crisis example, thus precipitating recession. also helped dollar rally sharply, high 1.8200 marks european low 1.7880. economists said today's whiplash moves long term significance markets try keep underlying fundamentals mind. trade,"trade representative clayton yeutter said monday u.s. free trade agreements canada israel help pave way liberalizing global trading system. said canadian israeli pacts set back worldwide reform efforts general agreement tariffs trade (gatt) critics feared help them. gatt talks began year ago punta del este, uruguay liberalize global trading system include trade agriculture services banking. yeutter made remarks u.s.-israeli trade meeting marking second year bilateral accord. canadian-u.s. pact, signed two sides two weeks ago, yet approved u.s. congress canadian parliament. two free trade agreements (fta) would gradually remove tariffs barriers cross-border trade goods many services. yeutter said aftermath canadian israeli pacts ""other countries realized want continue access world's largest market, better get serious improving gatt."" pact israel, said, gradually increasing shipments ways canadian pact substantially increase gross national products countries. yeutter also said canadian israeli pacts serve important precedents progress gatt. yeutter said, ""increasing trade one keys enhanced political economic stability around globe."" said, ""a stronger gatt enhance prosperity, advanced industrial nations, also countries need increase trade order better standards living."" yeutter added important risk progress made israeli canadian trade pacts resorting protectionism. referring trade legislation pending congress would force united states take retaliatory actions nations large trade surpluses united states countries practiced unfair trade. legislation prompted growing u.s. trade deficit hit 156 billion dlrs last year still rising. yeutter said pressures congress act hard resist, pending legislation would undermine president reagan's efforts liberalize world trade. yeutter renewed threat white house veto. said, ""president reagan veto bill contains serious flaws, believe veto would sustained."""
crude,"dwindling global crude oil reserves lack major new discoveries recent years send world energy crisis 1990, former atlantic richfield co chairman robert o. anderson said. ""it's going come sooner anyone thinks,"" anderson told reporters addressing houston business lunch. ""i believe we're going see change world oil markets two three years oil becoming harder find."" anderson, retired arco last year form hondo oil gas co, said world oil consumption approaching 60 mln barrels day current excess capacity cushion 4.5 mln barrels day rapidly disappear. ""if looked around world, could scrape one mln barrels day shut-in production outside middle east,"" said. ""we're soon going right back 1973 1979."" anderson predicted world oil prices would end 1987 24 dlrs barrel continue gradual climb. ""there's way prices stay flat enough supply,"" said. ""there major oil discoveries past 15 20 years."" alaska's prudhoe bay oil reserves, last major world discovery, already produced five billion barrels oil half estimated reserves, said."

,"yugoslav prime minister branko mikulic, unveiling new draft economic program, said yugoslavia would cut repayments almost 20 billion lr hard currency debt bring line hard currency earning capacity. ""we decided coordinate repayment debt realistically assessed capabilities economy,"" said parliament. said current debt-service ratio (over 40 pct export revenue) high. yugoslavia negotiate long-term restructuring debt missing repayments recent months, mikulic said. ""if change dynamics repaying debt, situation would become increasingly worse,"" mikulic said. said present repayment schedule, yugoslavia would net outflow two billion dlrs level debt would halved 1995. added: ""the consequences would mean slower economic growth coming years also exhaustion economy lasting damage economy's capacity development,"" said. ""all would, course, intensify social difficulties,"" mikulic added. state news agency tanjug said october 9 yugoslavia plans adjust debt repayments next eight years cut debt-service ratio 25 pct. yugoslavia failed make principal repayment due last month already postponed 90 days. mikulic's proposed economic program, also includes higher personal taxes well wage price restraint, intended serve basis debt talks demonstrate yugoslavia's ability eventually repay credits. program discussed approved parliament early november. mikulic said foreign debt retained level 1990 country able keep currency reserves equal three months payments. grain,"recent announcements moscow next year's grain production targets indicate soviets estimating year's grain crop 205 213 mln tonnes, agriculture department analysts said. usda projecting soviet crop 210 mln tonnes, earlier estimates soviet officials 1987 grain crop could match 1978 record 237 mln tonnes. moscow outlined economic targets 1988 monday, putting grain harvest goal 235 mln tonnes. analyst soviet agriculture usda noted recent article izvestia said soviet grain production 1988 planned ""25 30 mln tonnes expected year."" ""this indicates estimate 205 213 mln tonne (grain) crop,"" analyst said. calculating moscow's crop estimate, usda used 235 mln tonne production goal, well 238 mln tonne figure published soviet economic journal month. usda's production estimate 210 mln tonnes reflects range 207 212 mln tonnes, usda source said. late season rains damaged soviet crops, slowed harvest progress lowered soviet production, analysts said. u.s. earlier month, soviet agriculture official viktor nikonov predicted grain crop would good better last year's 210 mln tonne harvest. member nikonov's party commented although 230 mln tonnes grain fields, harvest problems would bring final crop around 210 mln tonnes."

""the u.s. thought carefully would correspond iranian agression. proved iranians action met like-for-like response. today's action u.s. escalatory,"" pyne said. kleinwort grieveson's lambert said u.s. strike ""a responsible retaliation,"" u.s. apparently indicating iran could increase severity attacksf iran chose raise level conflict. chase manhattan's nicol took different view, however. said unable see u.s. achieved arab states kuwait saudi arabia, whose interests u.s. supposedly defending, feel less secure result u.s. attack fear sort iranian retaliation. initial upward market move morning reflected strong speculative reaction rumours u.s. attack thought one stage iranian missile launchers faw peninsula, close kuwait, analysts said. later downtrend followed confirmation u.s. navy attack iranian oil platform u.s. defence secretary caspar weinburger. market operators able evaluate situation gulf basis confirmed fact, finding less serious first thought, took profits, taking prices lower, analysts traders said."

cpi,"philippine 1987 inflation rate rise 4.8 pct 0.74 pct 1986 government implements employers' association recommendation 10 pct increase 54 peso minimum daily wage month, economic planning secretary solita monsod said. government's proposal across-the-board daily pay rise six pesos non-agricultural workers eight pesos agriculture workers, would push full year average higher 5.4 pct, told senate last week. 10 pct rise minimum wage recommended employers confederation philippines (ecop). ecop proposal would push year-on-year inflation rate 11.6 pct december compared predicted 14.4 pct government's recommendation implemented, solita said. proposed last month. annual inflation 1987 forecast four 4.5 pct national economic development authority early month. first three months year, inflation negative 0.5, 0.6 0.7 pct respectively, rising 1.0, 2.5 4.6 pct april may june, national statistics office said. annual inflation rate rose 5.8 pct june, 6.2 pct july 6.15 6.188 pct august september respectively, national statistics office said. attributed acceleration higher fuel water prices. government's six eight peso wage increases would displace 20,000 workers, monsod said, bringing number unemployed 4.2 mln 19.2 pct population."

""official statistics show reduction consumption vodka, deceptive statistic -- count home-brew,"" pravda said. ""the epidemic first engulfed villages also firmly settled cities, availability natural gas, running water privacy made much easier."" kremlin leader mikhail gorbachev launched anti-alcohol campaign shortly taking office march 1985 first step improving soviet economic performance, seriously hurt drunkenness among working population."

rubber,"international rubber organisation (inro) buffer stock manager aldo hofmeister said tests shown quality rubber stock acceptable, acknowledged consumers wary buying it. ""we said along rubber holding well condition quality standpoint...rubber stored proper conditions deteriorate,"" told reuters telephone interview. quality buffer stock rubber sold since entered market september would discussed inro council meeting opened today, said. tokyo traders said friday little interest buying rubber inro buffer stock possible poor quality. hofmeister began selling rubber prices exceeded ""may-sell' level 232 cents per kg early last month. inro's five-day moving average quoted 237.3 cents october 16. said quality five six-year old rubber stock uppermost consumers' minds. ""we received good interest rubber. understand japanese concern. many consumers want try rubber carry buying,"" said. hofmeister said inro rubber stored 28 different locations producing consuming nations, adding warehouses used suitable long-term storage. selling buffer stock rubber levelled past week 10 days could reflect ""wait see attitude"" buyers, said. ""consumers holding back buying additional amounts test rubber. tests positiive, likely buy more."" hofmeister said could reduce offer price buffer stock rubber stimulate interest inro want depress prices artificially. hofmeister declined comment japanese trade estimates sold around 30,000 32,000 tonnes kuala lumpur new york since september. said japanese traders position idea quantity sold, noting traders overall put buffer stock sales 25,000 35,000 tonnes. question sales original 360,000 tonne buffer stock expected main topic council meeting scheduled end thursday. current international rubber pact expires october 22. deadline new pact's start january 1989 hofmeister mandated continue selling rubber interim period."

ipi,"soviet union's industrial output growing slower pace 1987 1986 foreign trade fallen, central statistical office figures show. figures communist party newspaper pravda show industrial production rose 3.6 pct first nine months 1987 5.2 pct 1986 period. foreign trade period fell 3.6 pct 1986 period exports fell 0.5 pct imports dropped 4.2 pct. foreign trade nine months totalled 94.2 billion roubles. separate import export figures given. one factor affecting industrial growth introduction new quality control plan, western economists said. last year's calculations industrial output included goods, irrespective quality. new plan, introduced line soviet leader mikhail gorbachev's drive modernise economy, special inspectors right reject goods consider standard. pravda said 42 mln roubles worth defective goods rejected nine-month period. figures also showed october 1, 8,000 cooperative enterprises employing 80,000 people. 200,000 employed private sector, pravda said, without giving comparative figures. promotion cooperative private sectors economy important part modernisation campaign, measures introduced recently allow setting small shops private basis. labour productivity rose 3.7 pct first nine months 4.8 pct growth january september 1986. western economists said treat soviet productivity figures caution, broadly based west, measures worker output given period. pravda said 283.8 mln people soviet union october 1. january september 1987 period 118.5 mln people employed, rise 4.4 pct period last year. average earnings 200 roubles month 194 roubles year ago."
